text: The last time I ate here, the waitress was extremely rude and there was horrible service. They forgot two of our meals, and the waitress argued with us about what we ordered! It also took them 45 minutes just to make a sandwich! I would not recommend the food either. Disgusting.

Have been here a couple times. The first was a Balboa pizza and a beer with the gf after a long day of painting. Pizza was not bad...beer was entirely too complicated. They had just had a tap takeover, so drafts were basically unavailable. We both ordered the same bottled beer and they only had one left...too stressful lol. The second time, I dropped in with a buddy for a quick drink just after work hours. Place was deserted except for a couple guys at the bar, but for some reason the bartender seemed annoyed that we were there. Kept pressing for a second round and huffily took the menus away when we said we weren't eating. Strange. It's close by...it's available...and the pizza is solid. I'm sure I'll be back, but it's a shoulder shrug.

We'd always been willing to brave the consistently spotty service here because the food was excellent.  Not anymore. They've overhauled their menu, dumbing it down to the barest boring bar food options. Which might be okay if that's what you want. But even in practice, the actual food is barely edible. Won't be back. Sad to see this place go downhill so quickly.

A month ago this would have been a 4-star review. That was when, for date night, I could take my lady to our local bar. The food has never been spectacular, but their beer list is nice. Now that there has been new ownership you have been blacklisted. The sandwiches we received were pathetic compared to the food we had been ordering before. The menu's aren't up to date. It's just sloppy. It's a shame, too. The waitstaff/bartenders are great. The music is good, and it's a good atmosphere. The beer list is solid. If all you're doing is drinking then stop by.

Sadly, they have overhauled their entire menu...and not in a good way. My beloved jalapeño popper grilled cheese will be missed the most. Check out the new menu before you waste your time heading over like we did only to find nothing looks good.

Quaint corner bar with nice decor and ambience. Had craft beer, poutine and pizza. Everything was great, tasty and fresh. Server was just ok. Kid friendly atmosphere for an early dinner. Plan on going back again while I  am here.

Riverview seems to have changed a lot lately, and not for the better.  I don't know if they've had kitchen turnover, or what, but the menu is almost completely overhauled, and most of my faves are gone, including things like the from scratch ketchup.  It's not all bad - they've removed some of the upcharges for things like sweet potato fries, the chicken tenders/sandwiches are as tasty as ever, but on our visit we got a soggy and disappointing pizza that came out 15 minutes after everyone else's entrees arrived.  It was balanced by the excellent beer list and the new bourbon blue bbq chips.  But what happened to the nachos?  The gourmet grilled cheeses?  The avocado tempura tacos?  Riverview used to be our go-to for a casual dinner with out of town guests...it's going to be a while before we go back.  I hope they work out the kinks in the new menu in the meantime.

I was here on a Friday afternoon.  There was one server covering the front room and she was clearly overwhelmed.  It took 15 minutes to get menus after being seated.  We were told the credit card machines were down but we could still order while they were fixing it.  We ordered cheese curds for an appetizer however the portion was so small it was not much of an appetizer for the table.  Of the 4 in my group, only one meal came out correctly after finally ordering.  One ordered chicken with fries and received a burger with tots.  One ordered a different make your own burger with tots, but received fries.  When the one who ordered chicken had her meal sent back, she ended up being asked to have her meal delivered with the tots the second person ordered and had her eat off her friends plate for the fries while waiting for her sandwich to be recooked.  The 3rd incorrect order had  the correct side but incorrect bread and topping.  It took 10 minutes to get water refilled.  Getting a refill on any other drink was impossible.  To top it off, when we finally got her attention to get our check, we were told th credit card machines still were down and we could use the ATM and pay the ATM fee or wait for 20 more minutes.  We ended up waiting and were offered nothing to compensate for the miserable two hour experience, including still no refills on even water.  We paid in full for meals and gave up on telling her things were incorrect.  I've been here multiple times but this was a horrendous experience and not worth the return visit.

Don't bother coming to this bar for trivia. It's a joke and winning team had 9 people when the rules stated only 6 people per team. Of course, they said they were two separate teams, but they sat at the same table and conversed amongst each other the whole time. Fair? Not even close. Go elsewhere for your pub trivia, this place is a joke.

Went for brunch and got the caesar salad with chicken. Typically salads are huge wherever you go. This one looked like a side salad. There was maybe a tablespoon of dressing on top so I asked for more which never showed up. There were only four tables seated and two servers so it's not like it was busy. Also, can vouch for review of the nachos. The toppings are skimpy.

Had a great time at the beginning of my boyfriends sisters engagement celebration. We had an awesome guy server with dark hair (didn't catch his name) but towards the end of the night we ended up talking to a really rude bartender who didn't let us close our tabs and kicked some of my friends out for ordering a drink. Not a great way to end the night when they started off so positive. Would go Again but keep an eye out for this rude bartender with short hair and she had a nose ring.

Tried this place a couple times.  First visit was just ok, but gave it another shot. The next visit my burger came out still mooing because it was so rare (asked for medium).  nope, never again Riverview
This is our favorite neighborhood spot! They're always so attentive and very welcoming to our pup! :) get the grill cheese... And chicken fingers... And Mac and cheese... And John Daley cocktail!
I have come here for brunch a couple of times and love it. The bar has ambiance, the staff is friendly and the food is good. I recommend the bloody Marie's!
Nice neighborhood place. Grew up blocks from here, things have really changed for the better.

I come to Riverview quite often since it's close, but the service here is quite poor. Today we spent 40 minutes at our table after finishing our food to see our waiter. He walked by multiple times and never checked on us or removed the plates. I had to track him down. This is one of multiple times of poor service. There are too many places to eat around here for this.

This place isn't going to change your life, but we enjoyed our visit here.  We tend to be a bit snobby when it comes to our beer and we were pretty happy with their selection.  Husband ended up ordering a cocktail called Teatime which was boozy, delicious and not crazy expensive.  I tried the two draft porters they had available and settled on the Shipwreck, which was bourbon barrel aged and absolutely delicious.  It came in a snifter, was 12% alcohol and $8.  This is comparable in price and alcohol content  to a glass of wine, but the snifter definitely had more in it.  The service was OK, but we were there only people enjoying their dog friendly patio, so we weren't surprised that they weren't falling over themselves to run outside to check on us.

Really good selection at the bar and the food has never disappointed. It's a step above the usual bar food, like the almond-crusted avocado tacos. Those really delivered. Plenty of TVs make the Riverview a good spot to watch the game, and trivia on Wednesdays is a hoot. Definitely worth checking out.

Despite the mixed reviews, I had really high hopes for this place. I drive by here all the time, and have been curious about it because it has a nice, comfortable look, and they seem to have rooftop seating, which is a plus. When I finally visited, I was very disappointed. The pros are they have a very friendly, accommodating staff, comfortable atmosphere and decor with just enough kitsch without being tacky. They also have a large selection of beer on tap, but were virtually all ales. If you want a crisp lager or pilsner, you're out of luck - we're in the Midwest, I would think at least one on tap would be in order. I chose this place based on some of the food photos on Yelp. A photo of nachos looked especially delicious, so that's what I ordered. Not three minutes later, when they came out, I immediately thought, "See here, we're off to a bad start." Yes, it was during brunch time, but they do offer their entire menu. What I was served was a congealed mess of unmelted, shredded cheese with a cold glop of cheese sauce ladled on top of cold chips with a thimbleful of black bean and corn relish, not the deliciousness featured in the Yelp pic (see my photo). Not to make a scene, I tried to muscle through it because I was hungry, but after 3 chips I had to stop. They took it off the bill without a problem. Though it was a bad food experience, but I might be willing to give it another shot, just not during brunch hours.

Wide variety of beer, lots of IPAs.  It was in the middle of the day on Sunday with the Cubs game and playoffs hockey on tv. There were maybe 10 other people in the bar. The food was alright, but nothing to rave about. It's close to my apartment, so I would check it out again for trivia night, but there are bars closer to me, so if I'm going for a drink, I'd probably go to those instead.

I came with about 20 friends to watch the Mets home opener. I think at around 12:30, there were four other people eating there besides our group. They had a pretty decent beer list, though I wasn't very familiar with most of what they had to offer. I had a Half Acre Pony Pilsner, which was pretty good.  I ordered the BBQ ribs appetizer. I got about 8 ribs that looked really charred. I bit into one and I got a nice dose of char and some mostly dry meat. My guess is they were smoked and then finished on the grill, but they were done way too long.They came with brown mustard (who puts straight mustard on ribs?) and two BBQ sauces. I had to use a lot of BBQ sauce to make them edible. I will credit them for a few things. Hand cut fries. Big deal in my book. Also, I appreciate the owner sending all of us Fireball shots, so big props for that. But I wouldn't return unless it was for a group event.

My friends and I had the BEST time at Riverview Tavern! The legendary Bloody Mary lived up to its reputation, bottomless mimosas left us feeling very happy, my grilled cheese was superior, our waitress couldn't have been more engaging, and the atmosphere was inviting. I'm going to introduce some other friends to this place soon!
Love the food! Staff is great! I've tried to get a late drink during the week there and a couple times they were closed early. Which then made me go home and be productive... so still a plus!

This is our local go to place for lunch or drinks...or both.  They have some really good grilled cheese's, the jalepeno popper is awesome.  The service is always good, the beer selection is consistently great.  The pizza is really good, and so are the burgers.

The best and the worst. . . I had the BEST pizza of my entire life here yesterday!!! Smokehouse pizza with three different kinds of bbq'ed meat!!!  To Die For!!!   The service was also great (thanks for your attentiveness, Maddie!) everything was great except the waffles in my wife's chicken and waffles.  The chicken was cooked perfectly- hot, plump, fried just right, and flavorful!  The waffle , however, was inedible.  No kidding- it was as hard as the table- as demonstrated when we tapped the table with it. This would have easily been 5+ stars except for the waffle. We'll be back though- for sure!
Would give it 0 stars if I could. Slow service, the restaurant wasn't even busy, our server never refilled our drinks. Won't be coming back.

The food here has gone WAY downhill. I've recommended this place to a few friends and wish I could take it back. Food has habitually come out cold. They revamped the brunch menu a few years ago and have since scaled it back. Disappointing all around. One would think they would capitalize on the overflow from Kitch'n and Orange. Not a good option. Go here for a beer and watch "the game", nothing more.
Food is original and beer selection is good! Usually pretty low key so there is room for groups and a good view of tvs. They have darts!
Service is kind of slow but the food is not bad. Trivia nights are fun and it has a good atmosphere

I'm not sure if this was an average experience because of the things that happened or because of the bar itself... We came here after some friends' brunch wedding expecting a bar hop--the group stayed here all night. And it was just a lot of people fighting off the hangover from the brunch booze and trying to keep the drunk rolling. There were multiple fights (mostly girl drama) and some girl (I don't know if she was a regular patron or part of the wedding party) kept picking "fights" (and by "fights" I mean flirting) with my husband all night. She moved on from him to me when she thought I was moving in on her target...lolz awkward. Anyways, I just don't know if I'd choose to come back here because of the poor associations or just because it wasn't the most exciting place otherwise. Atmosphere seemed lacking and service was gruff.

Was looking forward to pub grub while I watched the Hawks. Thoroughly disappointed. Burnt chicken sandwich, ketchup that didn't taste like ketchup. Out of beers we liked. Btw; when you pour a pint, start what you finish, fill it up. Done here.

this place was cool solely on the fact that I surprised my brother who I haven't seen in a good bit (over a year) for his bachelor party. He was confused, he cried, he punched me, he hugged me and then.. bought me drinks! Every beer that I had was on point - can't list them here for you as I dont remember but it was not disappointing. Also got some grub, a pizza and a wrap of some sort and both of those were good. I'd go back for sure! Cool vibe, has a back bar/ seating area as well as the main dining area - which i did not explore too much.
Great bar food. Love the Tatar tots and their burgers. We usually order pick up, and our items are always ready in just a few minutes. Efficient and delicious

Came here today for a casual brunch. Restaurant is very average. Our waitress was friendly but the restaurant is understaffed. Service was exceptionally slow. Drinks and meals came out at all different times, and a turkey club meal was forgotten. Meal was brought out after they realized the mistake and was taken off our bill. Enjoyed my Riverview Bloody Mary but my Classic Eggs Benedict was underwhelming and lukewarm.

They have great burgers, plenty of beers and ciders and tap that change regularly with the seasons, and a ton of tv's for games. Their cheese curds are above par and the dipping sauce on the side is solid. My friends and I come back here time and again because it's a sure thing - good appetizers, plenty of seating, and a fun atmosphere!
took 35 minutes to get meal and it was not what I ordered. 20 minutes later I have no food. wish me luck.

So I decided to stop in here for lunch before going to a later Cubs game. Had the Mac n cheese, salad, blantons, and some beers. My fellow Cubs fan had the grilled cheese.  Food was amazing. Very good. Bartender was greatly helpful, chatty, personable, and seemed to have a great knowledge of what's going on in general.  The only disappointing part... We left, hell bent on coming back after the game for mini corn dogs. The place was closed before midnight, while listing hours until 2.  Loved the place, enjoyed the fresh food (most things, even ketchup are made in house) but wish I could have tried the damn mini corn dogs.

Thursday Night Bar B Q. Hit the spot for me.  I am a big fan of fall off the bone ribs. Not going to happen here but worth every bit of the fight of these babies.  My daughter Colleen got the pulled pork   Once the food arrived I did not hear a word out of her till she asked for a box   It must have been really good.  Excellent beer and drink menu.

Fair food at best.  We all received our food on a not crowded night but one person.  I finally had to get up, find the server and ask where our friends food was!  It wasn't worth waiting for.  Does not serve domestic beers other than Miller Lite.

Stopped here on a Monday night so it wasn't busy at all. We chatted with the waitress about the menu and got her recommendations. Wine bottles were 1/2 off so we went with that. The calamari was good but at the bottom of the bowl was a  pool of oil. The taco pizza sounded amazing but the dough didn't even taste cooked through, it was very floppy. I hate sending food back so I just asked for a takeout box instead. Popped it in the oven for 10 minutes and it was sooo much better! Next time I'll just go next door and get a take out since its the same menu.

Environment: 3/5. Pub, dart board, outside seating Waitress Hotness: 3/5 very cute waitress Service: 5/5 very nice bartender & quick service  Beer Selection: Ok. Not as great as they made it sound. Overall: it's hard to judge overall since I didn't try the food however I will update my review upon trying more. Beer selection...could be better.

Cocktails are nice. Service is spotty. The waitress was not knowledgable on the menu and specials, so I witnessed the bar manager talking down to her when she made mistakes. I would not recommend this place, although the patio seating is awesome!

This place absolutely sucks but because most of the restaurants in this neighborhood are subpar it gets by. The food has always been mediocre but it's an option to go to out of the 4 edible establishments in the vicinity.  Today we ate on the patio and from the moment we walked in to leaving both food and service were a huge miss. I stood in the entryway as a mousy server passed me multiple times without acknowledging my presence. Finally the bartender asked "can I help you?" I told him we needed a table outside then mousy server told us to sit wherever and she'd bring us menus.   We ordered iced tea and pepsi to drink, neither were refilled throughout the meals.  We had to go get our own silverware because we weren't given any.  The sweet potato tots (which are a $2.00 upgrade) were burnt to shit, looked to have exploded in the fryer and were happily served on both plates.  It's alarming the morons in the kitchen found it appropriate to even plate them and send them out.  I'm not a cheapass who looks for freebies but we really should not have even been charged for this crap.  Food sucked and service sucked. Won't be back.

It's old news that there are new owners and it's a different menu, so i am just going to update my review.   They offer a pretty wide beer selection.  Their burgers are quite tasty, especially the mini burgers.  On Wed, the mini burgers are $2 each and I had the black and blue and the Merkle's cheddar burger.  Since then I had the bacon brie burger and it was tasty too!   Their pizzas are so good.  I LOVE THE BALBOA PIZZA. I think it is one of the best thin crust pizzas I have ever had.  The bbq chicken pizza was good and I really liked the buffalo chicken pizza. The hummus is decent but comes with large pieces of red onion.  Do people really dip raw red onion in hummus and eat it?  I would rather more cucumber, tomato or pita bread than red onion.  They don't offer hummus in the "winter," but they still didn't have it when I went in June.  The grilled cheeses are really tasty too, and I think they do a special on Thursday nights. The tempura green beans are tasteless, no salt or any type of seasoning which was disappointing.  I would suggest staying away.  But pretty much everything else is really tasty.  I am rarely disappointed and we come here a lot. The trivia on Wednesday has much improved and we love the trivia host.   Love the outdoor seating as well.

This is a great neighborhood bar in Roscoe Village to grab a few beers with friends or to get some really good bar food! I've been here several times just for drinks and they have a great beer selection that is always changing. Prices are pretty standard for craft beers in Chicago. The bar tenders are good people and can offer some great suggestions if you ask. The food is really outstanding compared to most bars/taverns. I've only had the pizza but it was really good! Their menu has a nice selection of entrees and appetizers and there definitely is something for everybody. If you're ever in the area and are looking for a place to chill and have some good grub and a couple beers this is the place!
Not a fan. My beer tasted flat. The place overall seemed dingy. Floor was sticky. Bathroom was disgusting. Bartender aloof and unfriendly.

I went here for the women of craft beer event on thurs may 21 as part of chicago craft beer week, i loved all the beers i had, and they were all reasonably priced, (tho idk if the festival or the bar priced them) the hawks were playing that night, so it got pretty packed, but i was still able to order at the bar without much trouble, we had seats which was clutch. I dont have any complaints, though i just dont know how much was thanks to the festival or the bar, either way i was satisfied

Can here last night with a group of about 10 people, knowing it would be slammed because of the Hawks game. Knowing this, we all had our beer orders ready and when the drinks came we were prepared to order our food. Beers came out as expected, a few at a time as they were poured. I was stoked that they had some Three Floyd's selections. Food, on the other hand, came as 1-2 dishes at a time and were delivered as a server screamed out what they were. Two times different runners came out with multiple meals that were supposed to go to another table. My meal was never delivered. Within 45 minutes everyone had either finished or just received their meal. I told our waitress that it hadn't been delivered and that she could just take it off the bill and her response was, "That's weird. I wonder where it went." Needless to say we won't be coming back.

Waitress came to take our order and then didn't come back for 30 min. Cook and staff were obviously drinking on the job instead of attending patrons. Things were forgotten from our order, and the cook came out and yelled at me for mentioning what was forgotten "WELL, DO YOU WANT IT OR NOT!" Not a fan!

Awesome atmosphere - kid friendly. I had the jalapeño popper grilled cheese with sweet potato tater tots and a Two Brothers Pale Ale. Both were delicious!  Our server was knowledgeable and attentive.  We will definitely be back!

Extensive beer list and awesome Wednesday night trivia. The place itself is a bit run down but who cares when the servers are fun and you get a beer for five bucks? The friendly service, fair beer prices and frequent specials on local beers make this one of my favorite local neighborhood bars.  Definitely worth a try if you're in Roscoe Village.  No snootiness or overpriced signature drinks here- this is a great place to go for a few beers with friends.

Having lived right down the street for nearly 4 years, this used to be our go-to neighborhood bar - quick/close with good food and drinks. Sadly we'll be taking a break until they can get it together. Service has definitely gone down hill during our last few visits. Arrived tonight with party of 7 adults +1 toddler and was told they only had one menu available (restaurant was not crowded at all). Shared the one menu for about 20 minutes until more became available. An extra glass of wine was accidentally brought out with the first round of drinks (which took another 10+ minutes) and when we pointed out the error it was taken away but still appeared on our bill. Appetizer order of pretzels took another 20+ minutes and arrived completely cold/soggy. Had to flag a different waiter (ours had disappeared) to send it back. Took nearly an hour from the time we were seated for our meals to arrive, and the most simple meal of the group, a house salad, was never delivered. Had to walk around the restaurant and hunt down our waitress to let her know we were missing something. Again - had to get up and walk around the restaurant to find our waitress to bring the check, then find her (again) to remove the extra wine charge. All in all we spent an hour and a half there and had to go find someone every time we wanted anything - not acceptable for a place serving easy/basic bar food that was not even remotely crowded.

I went here for a college football game back in the fall and I was impressed by the place. Of course that impression is based upon the world of pubs in Chicago, where there are a dime a dozen and typically they serve average to below average food.  Riverview Tavern was not the case. I was happily impressed with their nacho appetizer and with their grilled cheese sandwich. Obviously those items are trailblazing and are standard fare at restaurants, especially pubs, but I have those dishes before in pubs across the city and they've been unmemorable or memorably bad.  Not as Riverview. I could tell there was a little extra effort there and I appreciated it and it didn't make me feel remorseful that I had to settle with eating at a bar.  In addition to the above average food they have a great beer selection on draft and solid service.  A win-win in book, and I'd happily go back to grab a drink and a bite to eat.

Decent space deserves better.  Good beer list, just OK service.  Too dirty to consider going back and not a chance I'd order food in a place so desperate for a broom and mop.  Three words of advice: spring cleaning mandatory.
Food's amazing. I love the beer list. The service has always been great!!! I go all the time and have not been let down once.  NICE JOB GUYS!!!!

I'll be honest, we've lived in Roscoe Village for years and didn't like Riverview.  HOWEVER, the food has gotten way better in the last year.  Their burgers and grill cheese are top notch.  At this point, I'd say they have the best food of the big four bars at the Damen/Roscoe intersection area.

This place was awesome. I went there after the big blizzard of 2015, so everyone in there was kind of frazzled. The waitress was really nice though, and we were able to get a table for lunch right away.  Anyways. My friends and I started with fried cheese curds with a spicy aioli sauce. That was super yummy. We were fighting over them by the end. There's also a section of gourmet grilled cheeses on their menu that was out of this world. For our main dish we ordered a spicy chicken wrap, the "yummy" grilled cheese (it comes with tomatoes and avocado but I went sans avocado) and the "savory" grilled cheese which included goat cheese and spices, among other things. The sides were tots and fries and we were all seriously pleased with the food. I'd order my meal again, hands down.  Since this is only a few blocks away from my friend's apartment I'll probably be coming back again.
Iowa ex-pats, check out their taco pizza! Better than Happy Joe's, yeah I said it.

Overall, a meh experience. It's a typical neighborhood bar, with prices a bit higher than what can be had elsewhere. Not a place that stands out in my mind, just a mediocre place to grab a bite and a beer. Service has been OK when I've gone, though a bartender insisted I had one more drink than I had, which was fun because she straight up said nope, you're lying, you're paying for what I say. I don't usually fight about a $6 drink unless I'm right, which I was. But since she was a B****, and $6 isn't the end of the world, I didn't let it get to me too much.

My wife and I stopped in here for the first time to watch the final minutes of the Cotton Bowl to see MSU come from behind and defeat Baylor (excellent game!). We both ordered burgers (I had the Kobe Beef) and she had a bacon cheddar burger. Both were excellent, as were the fries. That's all that I can say about it as we didn't stay very long or order any drinks.

My friends and I went here today and 6 of us waited for over and hour for our food which was then Cold when it came out of the kitchen. Did they cook it and then let it sit for a half hour? Nobody knows BC the waitress was terrible and would go "check" on our food and then never come back and report to us. To top it off 2 of us had to wait an hour and a half to receive our food bc they forgot and never bothered to ask us if we needed anything else.. Like maybe the meal we ordered. ALL THE FOOD WAS COLD and even if it was warm it still would have been mediocre. I'd say don't bother going here bc it sucks.

This place is absolutely terrible. Overall look is great. Plenty of TV's to watch sports and a cool "pub" feel. BUT, it stops there. Ordered a "Hail Mary" drink and they ran out of skewers so not only did they bring me a bloody but it was a plain bloody with no garnish at all. We ordered food during the 1st period of the Blackhawks game and it is now the 3rd period and the food has yet to arrive. The server has compensated two rounds of drinks to try and make up for it. Place isn't full and the food wait is still over an hour. DON'T GO HERE. AWFUL

We visited the restaurant on a Sunday afternoon. The atmosphere was nice but we walked in and waited five minutes before we even saw someone who worked here. After we were seated it took another ten minutes before we saw our waitress and after she took our order she didn't return for the entire meal. I had the Thai chicken tacos and they were good but needed more sauce (and I had to flag down the waitress to get some). My boyfriend had the chicken and waffles and they were awful. The chicken was pressed thin and over breaded in some weirdly spicy coating and the waffles were nothing special. We were never offered water or drink refills and we were never asked how our food was. I have no desire to return here for overpriced food and bad service.

My boyfriend and I came here yesterday because Commonwealth Tavern was too full. We both ordered the "gourmet" grilled cheeses. I've probably never been more disappointed. They came out cold, with a slice of cheese that wasn't even melted. However, the staff was nice when we sent them back and asked that they be heated longer. Service was slow.. When we initially walked in, it took more than 10 minutes for a server to greet us. Honestly, not a great experience when Commonwealth across the street is so much better. One other plus is that they did turn on the Cowboys game when we asked.

I've been here several times and have never had a bad meal. I love their grilled cheese, tots and bloody marys. I also really enjoy the old bar atmosphere. The one negative is that their service does suck, but it's in my neighborhood and I like the food, so keep coming back.
Great beer selection, delicious apps (especially the cheese curds!), and awesome service!!

Food was decent, not too overpriced. However, service was horrible and based on the friend I'm staying with who eats here frequently, this is a common thing.  We sat down and it took 10 minutes to get asked if we would like something to drink. Every time we asked for anything the waitress seemed extremely put out by the request.

Meh, didnt love it. The Jalapeno popper grilled cheese was good, however, everything else is just okay. Nothing mind blowing. A bit more pricey than the average "bar food" places with a similar quality. The atmosphere in the place was neither friendly or unfriendly, and there was no real vibe to be had. Overall, just really blah.

As last time out I had only had drinks here, I wanted to come back and try the food.  Wife and I ordered some burgers and they were quite tasty. I had the black and blue burger with cracked black pepper crust, melted blue cheese and mushrooms and wife had the hickory bacon cheddar burger.  As was the case last time, service was friendly and attentive. The waitress really knew the beer menu which I appreciated and was helpful when it came to pointing out suggestions for us to try. Also a number of specials such as half off glasses of wine, $1 off Chicago beers and $4 pints Sierra's doesn't hurt either! Food came out super fast and was cooked as ordered. Wife likes her burgers medium with some pink and I like medium well with no pink but not overcooked. Both were exactly on the spot. Not a lot of places get this right. You ask for medium well and you get a bloody mess that's totally undercooked. Burgers came with these Parmesan parsley fries which were also quite tasty. Fried crispy, perfectly done. Winner.  There was also a nice sidewalk seating area along Damen that looked inviting (although we sat inside) Overall, nice place. Definitely would come back and highly recommend it if you're looking for a good burger and a beer.
Fantastic service and bar food. The place is never empty, but not so crowded that you can't find a table with a television view--even during a Hawks playoff game!

Much improved over recent years. The draft selection is really great now, descent prices. You will not see miller lite or summer shandy on the draft list thank goodness.  The burgers are a definitely better than the standard bar burger, best in roscoe village. Good atmosphere and friendly service.

I really like this place, I was here to watch a couple of the Blackhawks games, since they have a lot of TV's and a great bar feel.  My girl and I had drinks appetizers and sandwiches.  We shared the mussels, not so good.  They were fresh, just not PEI mussels; yes, a big difference guys!  If you charge 11.99 for mussels, please serve a better quality, mussels aren't that expensive.  Sorry, this was the only negative, as everything else was very good.   I had the Waygu burger, they call it Kobe, but we all know you can't buy Kobe in the US, period.  Anyways, it was very good, surprisingly good actually.  I had it with swiss cheese and grilled onions, yummy!  I would go back, just for the burger.  I also had some sweet potato tater tots, which were different and tasty.   This is a good place to visit for any ball game, as it's a true sports bar.  I will be back to watch the up and coming world cup matches.  Save me a seat!

Been to Riverview a few times for dinner and drinks as well as early 11am brunches. Both seem to satisfy me!  I've never had the opportunity to sit at the bar, however I've continuously enjoyed my time spent here. In my opinion, they have great food-I'm not usually picky when it comes to bar food anyway and the drinks were good too. The prices are average, the service is fine and the location is nice. Riverview's been my go-to for casual nights and late mornings!

I was really pleased when my burger was served. Large, pretzel bun, pickles on the side, generous with the crispy fries. The only problem(at least in my opinion) was that the burger was salty. I admit it, I've become the salt 'police'. If I want salt on my food, I salt it myself. I like to start with a plain, unseasoned burger.. I did have mushrooms on the burger, but there were not a huge amount of them, if they were salted, as well, to explain why every bit of burger was so salty.      Otherwise, this is a comfortable spot to have a drink or a bite to eat. Lots of TVs to watch.  The wait staff was great.  Next time I go(or go anywhere for that matter, as salty food seems to be the norm these days) I will be ask in advance if seasoning/salt is used and ask that they omit it entirely.

I've been here several times with friend and still not impressed.  The pricey food is meh and the service is not good.  It's seems to appear the waitresses don't want to be of much service(perhaps on purpose).  It took forever for someone to come to our table. Whereas we moved to the bar, negative!  There's no friendly atmosphere in there, no vibe, no thanks.

I like Riverview Tavern.  My fiance and I live in the neighborhood, and it is the perfect place to just go and grab a beer with friends or a quick bite.  I'm from Colorado where Coors Lite is on tap everywhere, but this is the only place I can find it in Chicago so far, so I'm a fan.  Super friendly staff.

My wife and I keep coming back to this place, and in our time in Chicago it's become our local.  Why? It's solid and reliable. We really like the food. They have a well varied menu but the burgers are particularly good - large and generous and very tasty. I also particularly like the Cuban sandwich. Really good and really large beer selection. Usually have some sort of nitro stout on tap and plenty of IPAs. Yay. Friendly service, we can bring all our friends here and it's not pricey at all.

I stopped by the bar for dinner and was pleasantly surprised by the amazing beer selection. The guy behind the bar was very knowledgeable and made some great recommendations.  In addition to the vast beer selection was a large choice of different styles of grilled cheese, yum! Everything was very good. Highly recommended!
Meh--relatively bare, it's service was almost deliberately bad. And, seating at the middle tables is prohibited unless you have 8 people, and all present (what is this, kindergarten?).

Love this place!! Great atmosphere, amazing bartenders and wait staff. They are always on top of things, no matter how busy they are.  The Burgers and Grill Cheese are to die for not to mention thegreat beer selection they have.  It's a great place to go meet up with a friend or a big group of people.

Great pizza!!! You can tell that the chef (the waitress said his name was Chris) really has a passion for what he's preparing. Cool atmosphere, good beer list, nice specials... We had a great time. Thank you.

A terrible let down from walking in...this place is trying to save money by turning the heat down.  Kids meals are $6, tiny slider burger with a few fries...no wonder why it's free monday thur Thursday!   I ordered a burger done medium and it came out bloody...there was even blood saturating the bun!  Disgusting..no thank you! After I sent it back and asked for something else I was told "oh we won't charge you for the buger"...gee thanks!  No offee for anything else and barely an apology!  I had taken my family there one other time and it wasn't great then...I should have learned!  I should have also taken a hint that it wasn't a great place when only a few tables were taken on a Sat night!
Visited a friend here. It was ok but nothing special. The beer choice was pretty amazing but I wish the service was better. Food was good, I had a veggie burger with sweet potato fries. Not to bad.

This place is unbelievably blah. There is nothing attractive or exceptional about it.  They will not let you even look at the high table that takes up half of their main room if you are with less than 1,000 people. So don't even try.  Just bow your head and sit at one of the lonely little tables.   No mingling allowed.   I really wanted to like this place.   I did appreciate the mustache on one of the waitresses.  We went around Halloween.

Great looking City Bar. Lot's of TV's. Back room with pool table. Pretty good bar food. good beer selection. Nice bartenders. Good crowd. Un hipsterish, which is not a bad thing. Parking can suck though so be careful about getting those painful tickets.

We went in on a Saturday night and it was dead. Deader than dead. Acknowledge the bar tender with a wave and go sit in a booth near the back. We sat there for over 15 minutes and neither the bartender or server came over. Both were too busy watching tv.  We left.

We came here on a friday night.  A low key bar with not too many frills, friendly service and attentive.  The drinks here are priced just right and are tasty.  They also serve food here as well.  I had some fries and they were tasty.  If I am ever in the area, I would pop in for some grub.

Great Roscoe Village bar.  I love going there for lunch on a Saturday to watch football with good beer.  All the apps that I've had have hit home for me. I'm from the south and cheese curds aren't a thing down there. Completely blew my mind. Little blobs of cheese! Fried! These are so far my favorite in the city.  The burgers are always really good - and very inventive - and come with really tasty fries. These fries are on point because they're cooked to that crispy perfection on the outside and soft fluffy inside. Of course they go the extra mile and sprinkle on some parmesan happiness.  Lots of TVs with a ton of different games on. I'm not 100% sure who goes to a bar to watch golf, but if that's your thing, they've got your back too.

Everything about this place is mediocre at best. The crowd it draws isn't much better. All I have to say is you should skip going here especially when you could walk two blocks over to four moon! This place is like a cousin to Applebee's... That's not a good thing.

Oh man. I would like to like this place.  After all, I saw Tony Magee (sp?) play here during craft beer week.  He was great and bought the freshest Lagunitas for everyone in the house.  He's the owner of Lagunitas.  But, lo, we stopped by to get out of the rain on a Saturday night, and the staff were testy and weird.  We walked in and there were no small tables so our powerful party of two had to sit at a larger table.  We just took up a small corner, so anyone could have joined the table without engaging in conversation with us.  Which would totally be their loss, of course.  No one came over, noone acknowledged our existence for at least 20 minutes.  Finally we went to the bar to order, at which point the waitress shrieked " what are you doing?!!!!  Go sit down!"    She eventually stopped by with a sour apple face, and told us, we would have to move if some bigger group came along.  We cordially replied, "ok", and she took our order.  10 minutes later another waitress came over with a stern expression and said "you ARE GOING TO HAVE TO MOVE,  if some bigger group comes along, get it?"  We had already "gotten" it.   We stood up and milled about by the bar.  The waitress who had taken our order was just hanging around another table, so we told her we would just mosey on to another location.  The other  people there looked tired and sad, probably as a result of the same beleaguered wait staff tending to them.  Now, I have to say I think they were being mismanaged, and the wait staff are probably perfectly nice people.  But, and it's a big butt, I will not return (until it's raining and I have to go somewhere to take cover) again.
Riverview has some amazing mixologists.  It's amazing to watch how many Hail Mary Fil Your Face Bloody Mary's they serve up on a given Sunday.  Love their menu too.

The Goods -Surprised at how good the Merkt's cheddar burger was! -Serve Angus AND Kobe burgers! -Good selection of fries  -Good atmosphere -Not too busy on a Friday night in the Fall, but I'm sure this place is hopping during the summer -Good friendly service -Great beer selection - Dart board, Tv's and a Jukebox -Daily specials -They have cheese curds! The bad Parking can be tough at times in this neighborhood The ugly I'm coming back to crush the D.Rose Triple Kobe Burger! As you can see, the Goods really outweigh the bad!  Try a burger and beer here, you will be happy!

Riverview has defiantly stepped things up. They have expanded their menu , improved their food quality, and added a more than a few TV's. Most importantly they now have a really solid beer selection. In fact it's one of the few place I can consistently order Three Floyd's beers, without them ever being out. I probably just jinked myself, which is almost a pun since one of Three Floyd's Beers is called Jinx proof. Amazing how borderline puns are even less funny after you have to explain them.        Anyway, this is a great place to go for NFL Sundays as they have all the games showing  and TV's visible from virtually wherever your sitting. If you went here a year or so ago and it was a little too dive-y for ya, I would suggest giving them another try.

I'm not sure why people give this place a bad grade. It serves exactly the need it should as a pub. Very good but not outstanding food. I had their blue cheese burger and seasoned fries. Both were great and the service was fast as well. The only thing I cannot comment on is the crowd late night as I went during the day on college football Saturday.

Wanted to write an update on RV as we've been here numerous times since my last review.  Things have definitely improved.  I give it 4 stars now.  I received 3 fish fillets instead of 2.  The adult portions are larger than the kids, it seems.  They are super accomodating to families, which is great and we truly appreciate it.  Keep it up, RV!
So, they are not open until 10:30, the yelp info is wrong... Otherwise, good spot in the neighborhood with great food.

I can sit at home and watch the Bears game. We go to bars to watch all the rest. 20 plus TV's and only 2 had a different game on.  Last resort from now on!!!! However, the food is good and it's kid friendly so I'd come here any other time, but definitely not for football.

This place is a secret gem, always there to give me exactly what I want: insanely delicious food at reasonable prices for any meal or gathering, in a cool setting paying tribute to a lost Chicago icon (the Riverview amusement park). The BuffalOMG burger is absolutely insane, their veggie burger is maybe even better (and I love meat burgers) their fries are like funnel cake but better than that even!! All the breakfast burritos smoke my brain in the most pleasant of ways, and each time I leave I cannot wait to come back. Oh, and since it's in an area typically frequented by people much too upscale for such an unassuming spot, and the hipsters would rather wait in line at Cafe Lula for their brunch needs, you can always get immediate seating, and most of the time this huge bar is anything but overcrowded at dinner too. I would give this place ten stars if I could. But stay away -- don't ruin this place! Truly a great place to get stuffed or slam some beers with your friends, family, or enemies (whom after eating here will become your friend!).

I live in the hood and have frequented this establishment several times, however - since it came under new management about 1 1/2+ years ago Roscoe has been hurting... I really want to like this place, but the menu and service are not at all what it used to be. I really miss well cooked burgers and a beer selection that you can count on being in stock. Save yourself some time and try one of the other establishments in the area... You'll be happier. P.S. my server, though attentive, was almost creepy in her hovering over me until I made a decision on both my food and my beer... Ick

So I have been to this establishment several times in the past, mainly because it's located right by my work, but today's experience has really reassured I shall not be back. First and foremost out of four things we asked for on the menu, they had one and it was not as advertised. Apparently, they don't serve pizza until after four (which is not communicated on their menu anywhere) and they have never had patron tequila (even though their margaritas specifically state that's the ingredient). The food was mediocre and definitely nothing to brag about. The most disappointing thing about the whole experience, THE SERVICE STUNK! The one gentleman who was serving the whole restaurant was probably the worst server I have ever encountered. Not only was he inattentive but he lacked the charisma to make up for his horrible service. We actually had to seek him out in order to pay our bill after he dropped it off. If you are coming here I would come just for drinks, by drinks I mean exclusively beer, and don't order food unless you plan on it taking forever and not being worth it.

I really liked this place. I went yesterday with 4 friends for the Sidebar Comedy Show and it was awesome. The waitresses/bartenders are very sweet and accommodating. Despite having a full room, the drinks came out quickly and so did the food. They have a very large selection of alcohol. Food, too - I got a Cali-Chicken and it came with Parmesan fries, it was so delicious. The staff is very friendly and polite, the food is great, and a lot of the beer is on tap - how can you go wrong? We will definitely be back for the great comedy, food, service, and beer!

We went to Riverview Tavern for a dinner with a large group.  We called just 5-10 minutes before we arrived.  Although we were seated in one of those higher tables, they were able to seat us within 5 mins!  Always a plus when you have a big party with us.  We ordered various food items, from mussels, to pizza, cheese curds, and kobe burgers.  No complaints about the food at all. They were busy, but the server/staff were generally helpful and friendly.  Definitely will come back, esp. if they have kids specials.

Riverview Tavern is amazing! The entire staff is so personable and very fun! The menu is incredible.. Nothing is better than the merkts cheddar burger!! I live in roscoe village and hands down this is the nicest spot in the neighborhood. Kid friendly. And dog friendly on the patio! This is simply a relaxing place to eat and have some craft beers with friends and family!

I really wanted to like this place since it's very close to home, but it just hasn't worked out. We've had a few good experiences here, none great. But once we ordered some curds which many of them were just fried pieces of breading with no cheese inside and were overly greasy, gross! Plus, the same night, our food was served by a guy who I guess was from the kitchen, with very long hair and no hair net. Kind of killed my appetite when the food showed up. We also wanted to love the pizza restaurant attached, but went in there once and ordered a beer that we were going to drink while we waited for our pizza to cook. Well, the the employee told us that he'd bring it out, after over 5mins we asked about it and then was told the keg needed to be changed, but no alternative was offered in the meantime until we suggested it. The guy knew we were going to drink the beer during our 15min wait for the pizza so to take almost 10 minutes to serve it while we sat there was pretty poor. The service hasn't been great any of the times we've gone here. The pizza is pretty good but the service makes me not excited to keep going back.

DO NOT GO TO THIS BAR. During the Hawks game, they would not let customers sit at the nice tall bar tables in the main room unless you had a party of 7 people. The manager was a complete jerk when I asked him about it. THERE ARE 100's of CHOICES in the area.  Don't choose this place. As it turns out, the deal was that the bar sponsors sports teams that they like to save the tables for.  Did they tell us that this is what the tables were for?  NO.  Did the tables sit empty for the 1st 2 periods of the Blackhawks Stanley Cup Final game? Yes.   This was an easily resolved situation.  Explain to us that the tables were reserved for the sports teams.  Buy us a beer for our trouble.  Lets us sit there until they show.  Any number of ways could have eased this situation.  The moron bar manager pursued none of them.  He could have cared less.  We spent over $80 between 3 of us in the first 2 periods.  We left to watch the game in another bar.   That guy can suck it.  I will not return.   There are a lot of places that appreciate your business  Riverview Tavern is not one of them.  Look elsewhere.

I love this place!  I have kids, so from 430-730 kids eat free.  Its in a great neighborhood, close enough to Wrigley to grab a bite and a drink before the game, but far enough away you wont be bombarded with "yah brah, *highfive*"  We try and come here a couple times a month to watch a game and eat with our 4 year old.  Its win-win, because we get an awesome selection of local beer, and he gets chicken fingers and sprite.  They're open from like 11am-late, i'm not really sure.  we usually go after work. Street parking is a joke, its everywhere.

Worst experience ever. I was served a burger with a bug crawling out of it. When I alerted the staff, the manager informed me that he didn't care, he was watching the basketball game.  When I chose to leave, he still charged me. He was very intimidating towards me as a female. I would warn any woman, as it seemed unsafe how his actions were toward me. Their health conditions in the condition are unsafe and their staff does not act appropriately.

Obnoxious bartenders - both the cute blonde and the Brian Posehn ( imdb.com/name/nm0692634 ) look-alike - made us feel totally unwelcome from the moment we walked in. Maybe they just needed to let us in on the joke and we all could've had an equally hearty laugh.  Doubtful though.  I thought that holier-than-thou attitude was the purview of bartenders in trendy NYC establishments, not some hole in the wall joint in northern Chicago.  Granted, it was a Friday night and the place was rockin' about as hard as the gas station mini mart across the street.  Nice beer selection though!

I've made it my mission to attend as many bars in Chicago as I can. While I've run into some forgettable establishments in the past, Riverview Tavern has certain etched its way into my A-List.  It was pretty busy last night, but there were multiple things happening at the same time so it wasn't much of a surprise. The Blackhawks vs. Redwings game as on, and there was an event for "Celebrating Real Women Of Craft Beer", so there was a lot going on. Hail to the Ale! Despite the fact that it was busy, my friend and I actually managed to secure a table pretty quickly, as we are both Eagle-eyed with Laser precision when it comes to navigating a busy bar.  Our waitress was phenomenal, and made the experience even better. She was new, but clearly she had been a waitress before. She was extremely attentive, helpful, and wasn't afraid to talk with us and joke with us. A true gem. She said she had been working at Riverview for 3 days. But if she didn't say anything I would have thought she was a manager or a veteran. We got our drinks almost immediately and we were pleasantly surprised that our food arrived in maybe 10-15 minutes. More on that later.  There was a special on craft beer's for the night due to the event and our waitress was kind enough to bring us samples of different beer so we could "try before we buy." We actually wound up trying four of the beers on the list. I am newly single, and definitely had a special affinity to the "99 Problems," saison beer because of that. I ordered a Cali-Chicken Sandwich and my friend ordered a Hickory Burger. The food only took 10-15 minutes to arrive much to our surprise considering how busy it was. I loved the sandwich - it was cooked very well and the ingredients mixed very well together. Chicken, Bacon, Avocado and Cheese...how can you go wrong?? My friend filled up before finishing the Hickory Burger so she gave me a bite to try it...the meat was well prepared and the hickory BBQ and onion strings gave it a great flavor.  I hear this place has great Bavarian Pretzels and Wings...we will definitely be coming back to try them out!

I dare someone with a huge appetite to try the Oink, Tweet, Moo Burger and tell me you don't like it.  Aged sharp cheddar, smoked bacon, fried egg, 1000 island, lettuce, tomato, onion for $11.99 on a pretzel bun with some serious weight to it.  Oh, and yea you can get sweet potato tater tots on the side with that... yes please.  How often do you see that on a menu? first for me... Our table started with Bavarian Pub Pretzels - dips were maple mustard, ale cheddar dip, spicy cracked mustard.  It was delicious for sure.  My problem was a user error, because eating this appetizer sort of spoiled my anticipation for the pretzel bun on my burger.  Yes, I'm like that. Very solid craft beer menu too. Cool atmosphere - we went early for dinner but I can see it heating up later on.

We went here with our two young kids on a weekday and had a great meal. You can practically eat for free with the specials they run Mon-Thurs. I got a brie burger and thought it was really good; nice big patty, chunk of cheese, toasted bun and the fries were very tasty and well seasoned. They had a good selection of beers too and the server was attentive and polite. We'll definitely go back-especially with the kids. Seems like a nice neighborhood place.
Hands down the best buffalo chicken sandwich in Chicago. I also come in on the weekends for the chorizo eggs benedict followed by a moscow mule for brunch. Can't beat it

I used to go here all the time, until the new owner Pete arrived. He changed a lot of things, some good some bad. My bad review isn't because of the food, but more so the service. Particularly the manager Pete. I live down the street from the bar for the past 3 years. For the second week in a row my order and bill was messed up. Pete didn't seem to show concern at all for the mistake and even made me feel like it was MY fault. I used to recommend this place, not anymore. They have "specials" that aren't specials, meaning they will advertise them on their website, then you order it, the bill comes, and the "special" isn't reduced in price. The reason being: there was an "event that night." Well you should let your customers know on your website, and/or in the restaurant that the special is not any good during "events" (I am not even sure what constitutes as an "event"). And don't make me feel like it's my fault for not knowing - ITS ADVERTISED ON YOUR WEBSITE! If you want a local bar, with a VERY friendly staff and good food with a nice beer garden, go down the street to Village Tap or Four Moons.
Beers are awesome! Great place. Mouthwatering grill cheese is tasty.

This is a larger bar with a good amount of seating.  It has the typical set of with bar, televisions and gaming.   We had some Coors and a quesadilla.  The quesadilla was below average even for bar food.   Plain tortilla with dry cheese and too many onions.   I had to get a shot of Jameson for $5 to wash down the horrible quesadilla taste in my mouth.  I felt better after that.

So I came here for the first time this past Saturday night with my sister and brother.  My sis had told me they have changed the menu and that her and her and her husband have been real happy with the changes.  We had a great time and had good service as well.  We started off with the cheese curds which in my opinion were the only disappointment of the night.   They were just too soggy and hard to eat (maybe they were undercooked), but the paprika aioli that came with them was excellent.  The three of us all had burgers, I believe mine was the hickory, my sister had the spicy one and I can't remember what my brother had but we all liked ours a lot.  All came on pretzel buns which help up nicely to the sandwiches.  The big surprise in my opinion were the fries.  They were awesome.  My brothers had parmesan cheese on them (large in size and crispy in a good way not a burnt way), I went with the sweet potato which were great (nothing special with these but better than average), and they also had tots, both regular and sweet potato.  I would recommend trying some of their different aioli's (they were great with the sweet potato fries and burgers), we tried a couple and liked them all.  I will be back!

This place redid their menu a few months ago and went from being totally average to very good. The starters menu is the best in roscoe village. go for the bavarian pub pretzels, the cheese curds and the sliders. they also do maple bbq wings and great pizzas - buffalo chicken is my favorite. beer menu is serious and ever-changing. they have the staples like lagunitas little sumpin sumpin and bottles of alpha king, but you might also get lucky and see a founder's devil dancer or other hard to find seasonals on tap.  the only thing that i get tired of is the amount of kids here between 5-7pm. I get that people with kids want to go out, and i certainly don't mind seeing a few kids in the bar every once in a while, but this place can get to be like a daycare center at times. stay away from the back room if you want a more adult atmosphere.

A large group (16) gathered at Riverview on Saturday for brunch at 12PM, noon.  By the time we all arrived, the bar still had an entire empty room, but the staff made us wait around to try to crowd around a few small tables while we waited for other customers to finish eating and leave.  We waited and waited and waited... an hour later we had been served one drink and FINALLY had a table.  While the drinks were fine, totally overpriced for the spot- a beermosa (OJ and a bit of cider) at $7. Once our order was taken it took another 45 minutes to come out. Yes, we had a large group, but its not that hard to quickly serve up some bar food.  (Again they weren't incredibly busy).  We eventually got our food...  I had ordered the Country Benedict.  My meal was luke-warm at best.  The Benedict seemed fine so I ate it.  The potatoes it was served with were some of the worst ever - so terrible that we couldn't even eat them doused in hollandaise sauce or ketchup.  Cold, rubbery, dry, a few days old and perhaps slightly rotten describe the potatoes.   Sorry to be graphic here, but the result of this meal was a severe cause of diarrhea for not only myself, but many members of the group.  Clearly there are some unclean food practices here.   To top it all a gratuity had been added to the bill, so despite the poor service, we had to pay them for great service.  Even the toddlers in the group had enough and were beyond cranky by the end of this horrible adventure.  Never again!

Great spot for Trivia!! Great questions, fast moving, good turnout, and they award for the Best Team Name, too! Man, there were some creative (and kinda sick, in a playful way) team names there that night, most names were really hilarious and added to the fun of hearing the rankings called out.  Their menu is great, typical bar food, but for you novelty eaters- they do have two interesting menu items. First, the Taco Pizza, topped with crushed up Doritos. I did not try it, that is not my cup-o-pizza, but my friend did and he really liked it. They also have, for a whopping $35, The "D.ROSE TRIPLE DOUBLE"- Desc below pulled from their website: Two 8oz Kobe Beef patties, 3 slices of cheddar and pepper jack cheeses, topped with fried "Englewood" onions, and buffalo sauce on a pretzel bun. Served with fries, pickle, and a bag of Skittles YIKES. I WILL BE BACK AND SOMEONE BETTER ORDER IT ONE OF THESE TIMES...
Best sportsbar in Roscoe Village! Food and Service great as well. Dont miss the parmesan fries! Great food menu, caters as well to Families!

I am sad to join the chorus of people bemoaning the "new" Riverview.  This place used to be one of my favorite neighborhood haunts, but it came under new management earlier this year, and we quickly stopped going there.  My husband and I usually hit a neighborhood bar for bar dinner/a few drinks on Thursday nights (often on Friday/Saturday nights too, actually).  We used to walk up to Riverview a lot.  It had really good food and a great booze list, the relevant game was always on, and there was usually somewhere comfy to sit.  It was a little louder and more crowded on weekends, but still usually somewhere to sit and not horrifically loud and crowded (I need to be in exactly the right mood to put up with a bar where I need to stand shoulder to shoulder).   So a few months ago we went in there for dinner and it was apparently under new management.  Th food menu was completely different.  None of our old favorites (the honey chipotle wings, the sweet potato tots, the tacos) were there.  Instead, a pretty limited and uninteresting menu.  I can understand new management deciding that the old menu was just too huge and too expensive to keep up, but getting rid of everything does not make sense.  The booze list is also now much much more limited.  We have decided over a few visits that the new food is ok at best - not particularly interesting.  My husband did get a thoroughly undercooked batch of wings on our first visit. This place also seems to be having an identity crisis.  I was not allowed to just sit where I wanted  - a host sat me (and I wasn't given a booth by the tvs but rather an uncomfortable table alone in the front room despite the place being pretty empty).  There are a bunch of crayons on the host table.  I do not know if you are permitted to have a table if you are only ordering drinks.  I can't tell for sure if Riverview still intends to be a pub or if they intend to be some sort of a restaurant.  (Granted, someone else said this was just another noisy bar, so my experience on this front may have been unique based on the time I showed up.)  Also, I did not recognize any of the staff members, which made me sad because the old staff was really nice to me.  Hopefully they are still there and I hit the wrong time. In short, although I am sure the new management has the best intentions, I really think they cut and changed both the wrong things and  too much.  This place has at least temporarily been knocked off of my favorite neighborhood bars list - I'll stick with the Four Moons and the Village Tap.  I will keep my eye out for positive developments.

I am updating my review here because I came here for a bear/lions monday night football affair. I met a group of friends here, but I got there around the beginning of game time because I worked late. This was just an awful experience from beginning to end. I RELLY want to like this place but it keep disappointing. It was a full bar but not insanely busy considering it was a bears game on MNF. They were adequately staffed but we had horrible service. Beers were empty and we had to go to the bar to get more or wait forever to get a refill because our bartender was always hanging out at the bar talking and watching the tv. We had multiple instances where we ordered beer or food only to have the waitress not bring us what was ordered (for instance 3 beers instead of 4, thus one person was empty and confused as to why they didn't get their order). the poor service was one thing, because that could just be one sub-par employee and not the fault of the whole facility. Every employee can't be an all-star or give a crap about the customers. But when I got there at 8ish the game had only just begun and they were already sold out on multiple beers and appetizers (appetizers were the special). Just a really bad experience. thankfully the bears won and saved the night. No thanks riverview though.

Rivierview Tavern is a great local pub. I must preface my review with the simple fact that I was drawn here with the premise that this was a "Steeler Bar". The menu is large and semi-intimidating because there were so many things I wanted to try. I also really appreciate the 'Black and Gold' Theme menu for the game.  There were also great drink specials... I was drinking $3 Two Brothers bottles for the whole game. There is vast selection of draft and bottles to choose from. A beer drinkers delight indeed.  I ordered the 'Black and Gold' Burder which was a great burger. If and when I return for another Steeler game, I would like to try their brick oven pizza for sure.

We reserved their party room for a birthday celebration. They very kindly didn't force us to purchase one of their food packages. We ordered some of our own food and brought in cupcakes. They had the room ready for us on time, drinks were served promptly, all the plates and silverware were provided for us. They really went out of their way to take care of us.  We greatly appreciated the service. They have several rooms, lots of TVs, and great music.  They also service brunch and have bar trivia nights.  The food list here is extensive, and everything I've tried is great. If you enjoy craft beers, they've got a ton.  If you haven't been back since this place got new owners, give it a try.

This review has been simmering in my brainspace for a good two weeks, and I'm ready to let everyone know: the new Riverview is not worth your time or money. I called ahead for a takeout order, and was told they didn't have french fries in stock.  Thinking it was strange for a pub to run out, I gave them the benefit of the doubt and substituted a different potato. I had to sit at the bar for ten minutes because my food wasn't ready within the time frame stated over the phone. This is all picky stuff, I know, but what REALLY got me was when I got home and opened my containers: Fish tacos: ONE tortilla cut in half, and each half made into a "taco." Three quarters of the dish were chips, without salsa, that I later learned were stale.  Did I mention these two mini tacos were $12!? Burger whatever, cooked medium: Red and bloody, so much so that the meat wasn't actually cooked in the middle.  I thought about taking out the patty and putting it in the frying pan, but took a look at the filmy and thin cheese on top, and couldn't stomach it.  Another $12. The tempura green beans were next.  Not nearly as bad as the rest, but the tempura is so thin, you can't taste the batter.  Just tastes like greasy beans. I left $40 poorer (I was dumb enough to tip them), and ended up with stale chips and 3/4 of a burger left in my house that I couldn't stomach.  I took out my leftovers from the night before (from another restaurant) and ate THAT for dinner.

It was a dark and stormy moonlit night... Kinda. It was dark and raining and I didn't notice the moon. But we were a happy bunch and in a social mood after watching Roller Derby at Windy City Fieldhouse and wanted to continue our evening in a clean, well lighted place (nod to Mr. Hemmingway). I also wanted a place that had places to sit and was quiet enough for a conversation. Enter Riverview Tavern! We stumbled in and sat ourselves in a booth. Riverview Tavern had a lot of space - divided into at least two rooms. One room was more like a restaurant dining area and the other was more like a pub. A few groups of guys were congregated around the bar. As it was late, the server approached us and explained that the kitchen was closed but that we could still order drinks. Soon later, she told us we could order some flat breads if we did so quickly so we did! We ordered two of them. Long story short, between the ease of parking close, having my wish of a good place for conversation, having okay drinks and food, I am pleased with Riverview Tavern. On that dark and stormy night, it provided me a clean, well lighted place. Ba bam!

I went for brunch last weekend - and I like the new format way more.  Food was pretty good (although not memorable) but I will keep coming back for the bloody marys and to watch sports!  The bloodies were pretty fab when they were all dressed up!

Great burgers, I would put them up against any burger in the city.  The beer selection is huge, I try a new beer every time I am in there.  Everyone is friendly, the service is quick and the atmosphere is pretty even-keel.  It's not too mellow but it's not obnoxious.

We live just around the corner from Riverview and wish we loved it for how convenient it is.  We've had a few so-so experiences there but today was terrible. Maybe they weren't anticipating that many people would have the day off  for Labor Day, but everything was off, from the service to the quality of the food and timeliness of being served.   When we entered we were told to just sit in the back room, which was empty, even though there were a few tables in the front area open. We then waited 10 minutes for menus and water and another 10 for drinks and to place our order.  We then sat there, completely ignored for 45 minutes waiting for our food.  My husband finally went to the main room to ask if we could get our food to-go (our 16 month old, who was surprisingly well behaved for such a wait, was getting really hungry).  Our server said that would be no problem. 10 minutes later, our food arrived at our table, but not to-go.  Oh well, since it was finally there we were happy. My husband's order was completely wrong, sandwich, side, everything. My son's "grilled" cheese was 5 slices of processed american cheese between white bread, not even remotely grilled or melted. It was pretty disgusting. The side of fruit he received was a few small chunks of apple and some dried cranberries, clearly the garnish for a salad, not a side of fruit. My buffalo chicken sandwich was the only thing that was decent, although pretty impossible to eat without a fork and knife.    We won't be going back. Despite the new management, Riverview has sub-par service, food quality  and atmosphere.

Riverview Tavern is a great local pub if you are in the Roscoe Village area (not a destination, though if you are traveling far). Have been here for dinner on a Wednesday and drinks on a Sat night. Dinner - weather was gorgeous so sat outside. They had $2 sliders and everyone was great (bacon and brie, Merkt's - yum). Cubano Torta - one of the best I've had! Bread was great, good serving of pork and ham.  Drinks - it was kind of dead on a Saturday even with burger fest going on nearby....if you are looking for a chill place it's fine but it's not a destination.

Unfortunately this place has new owners now. Since it has turned over a new leaf, so has the kitchen!! My all time favorite, Chipotle-Honey wings are no more:( My very nommmmmy Cobb salad is also gone! Left to give this new menu a chance a few months back, I decided to go easy and try the NOT SO HARD to make "grilled cheese sandwich". Boy, was I in for a MAJOR let down! Upon receiving my tasteless, cardboard of a sandwich I noticed that "le fromage" was NON-EXISTENT! My TEXAS sized toast bread was merely being held together by A=UNO/ONE slice of cheese. Talk about going al fresco here! Since when does grilled cheese mean...grilled breadwich? With what was invested for the sandwich, I clearly could have gone to the Jewel to buy my own damn bread and cheese to MAKE my own sandwich at home! Not going down in my book as a "go-to" for family or friends in town for next years St.Patty's day stop.  ...and unto the next I say!!

I had no idea about the new owners and didn't see much difference in the interior or the menu. I don't come here that often, but I do try to come here a few times a year after various fests held on Roscoe Street. I was very surprised by how delicious their burgers were, so much so that I ordered the cheddar burger (again) last weekend. I agree with another reviewer that it gives Kuma's a very serious challenge.  Riverview is particularly loud after a fest, but isn't a fun crowd what you want from a bar? Otherwise, nice seating outside and spacious seating inside as well. More spacious than Mulligan's across the street. Bathrooms suck, but you can't have it all.

Two stars is for the beer list, which is fantastic and pretty extensive with craft beers. I was there on a Friday night sitting outside.  The service was flat out awful, we waited for10 minutes before a waitress came around.  Then, we we served food without any plates or silverware - I had to go in and grab some from the bar.  Food in general is just OK, which is unfortunate because the food at the old riveriew was top notch.  The pizza is a complete disgusting joke. Somehow in the transition to new ownership they forgot how to cook it. It was soggy in the middle- you pick it up by the crust and the rest of the pizza is completely limp. Too much cheese, no sauce, etc. If I eat there again, I am definitely going to eat something else. But, with other options such as Village Tap and Frasca I will likely take my business elsewhere.

This place to be a lot more fun than it is now. Now it's just a loud, lame bar filled with drunks.  Popped in here 'cos I was in the area for Roscoe Village Fest, but otherwise, I wouldn't go out of my way.

Good food, especially on $2 slider night.  I mean for bar food, it's pretty darn good.  Service is great.  My drink was kind of weak, I mentioned this to the waitress, and drinks were perfectly mixed from that point onward.  Went there on trivia night, good times if that's your thing.  They do it well, questions are posted on the TVs.

I love what they have done with the place, those clowns on the walls used to weird me out! Massively improved beer list which is my main draw now for sure - have not eaten here yet but everything looks and smells good! Staff was everything a neighborhood spot should be, friendly and attentive! I will be back for sure.

This would be a zero star situation. We ate at riverview for dinner a few weeks back and they served my husband a raw chicken breast.  It wasn't cooked but a little pink on the inside. . .it was mostly totally raw.  I think the outside was cooked about a millimeter or two on the ouside and the rest was pink.  Unfortunately my husband got two solid bites in before realizing.  He was so grossed out that he got sick on the way home.  Needless to say we won't be going back.

We stopped by last Friday night after they just re-opened and they definitely have some kinks to work out. First off, the $10 grilled cheese was very mediocre. For $10, you would expect cheese to be oozing out of the sandwich, instead there was about 1 slice of cheese. There was also an issue with our bill and it took about 20 minutes just to fix it. Hopefully they work out the kinks and get back to the place we used to know.

Nice looking bar with friendly bartender. The food is top rate for a bar and the place very spify inside and outside. it has a banquet room and two major parts of bar located in old urbanist structure that the city has been wise to retain. A very spacious bar and many different drinking choices. Add a great neighborrhood to boot and you have a very quality place.

I know I'm going to sound like a broken record, but if you ever went to the old Riverview you can't help but be disappointed.  My fiance and I went here a couple of weeks ago and since then have switched our patronage to Village Tap. First, we  ordered the nachos which came with chips covered, wait let me correct, sprinkled with a thin layer of cheese and toppings. I also used to crave the $2 tacos, which have now been replaced by $13 tacos (I think they are close to the size of the $2 tacos). Our food also took so long to come out they offered to comp our meal.  What that meant was they comped our entrees, not our nachos, or the drinks we had while waiting the 40 minutes for our food.  I know I'm complaining about something free, but I was so wildly disappointed in the new Riverview I feel the need to nitpick.  If you decided to visit make sure you have a lot of cash and an appetite for small portions.

New ownership has remodeled the interior but that's about as far as the improvements go. The interior staff was rude and unhelpful. We stopped in to have a few beers and throw some darts - took us 5 minutes to be offered a drink while standing at a virtually empty bar (her conversation was much more important than engaging new patrons).
