Then when we asked for some steel-tipped darts they wanted to charge us $2 for them! I've NEVER had to pay for steel-tipped darts ANYWHERE. The new ownership needs to wise up and offer specials that compete with their next door neighbor, Mulligans and stop nickel and diming people on things like darts - Especially when Mulligans has 7 free boards right across the street.

Disappointed. We live in the neighborhood and Riverview has been our go-to spot for years. We went tonight to give the new ownership a shot. Food was so over-priced and average. My chicken sandwich was pink, had too send it back. My husband's 14 dollar burger tasted like lighter fluid. And we paid 6 dollars for two tiny chicken fingers for our 1.5 year old. Wish we could have the old Riverview back.

New owners, bye bye Robey's Pizza and hello jacked up prices.   One of the best things about Roscoe Village WAS Robey's Pizza (owned by Riverview).  Darn good pizza (Robey's pizza with roasted garlic!) and a good price.  Riverview HAD pretty good sandwiches and good prices.  Now after 1 and probably only try I have to say that they have so-so sandwiches (my brother had a burger and he gave it a B, my g/f had a turkey club and she also gave it a B).  I had the NYC Pastrami. I was hoping/expecting a pile of good deli pastrami, NOT.  It was the smallest serving of pastrami I've ever seen (and at $10), it was suppose to be warm but I think it was barely above room temperature and please get rid of the 1000 island dressing and put on more pastrami!   Craft beer selection is average for a "craft beer" bar.   Oh well, at least I have several other great places to eat in RoVi!

Very disappointed in the "new" Riverview...new owners or management. Memorial Day lunch was overpriced, table was sticky/dirty, sent back the fish and chips due to greasy/oily taste. The children's menu very overpriced......a children's grilled cheese (half a sandwich) is $6. The adult grilled cheese (full sandwich) is $7.....might as well order the full size. The children's drink is $2...full size is $2.50. Food is otherwise very average. So sad..hope they will make some changes.

I'm in total agreement with the most recent reviews.   I have been a regular at the Riverview for the last 8 or 9 years.   I always order the same items and will tell anyone who asks that the Riverview has the best tots.   So, my husband and I decide to head there for lunch today.  I was shocked to see a changed menu but figured they would retain a variety of the same items.   It has completely changed.   I couldn't get close to the salad I have come to love from the old menu.   The biggest shock...the prices.  $14 for burgers!   Our tab - with tip - came to $55 for a salad, a burger, pretzels and two lemonades.    I also agree with the assessment that they are missing the mark on the environment.  I can see that they have invested a nice chunk on TVs to make this a more attractive sports bar, but the food has been moved to (if only in price) an upscale eatery.   My husband noted that there's no way he'd head there with a group of buddies for food and beer while watching the game.  The tab would be ridiculous.    Sorry, new Riverview, but you're just missing the mark.   We can get this bar food at a number of other places for a much better price.   It feels like a sad end to a fond relationship.

An old "regular" here, we have great memories of taking the kids and sitting in the back "game room". Lots of families did the same. it was good vibe, the 5pm set.  We were SHOCKED at the prices of the "new" Riverview. $14 for a burger? $14!? Maybe the new owners should have done better research on the neighborhood. Sure, the food is very good, but the price just isn't right. It's far too expensive to make a habit out of, esp with the family. We'll just have to go somewhere else.

Riverview! I was excited to come back to town and head back to my old stomping ground. Rumor was that it was under new management but it'd been so long since I'd visited that I honestly would never have known. The bartender was so friendly (and if my brain wasn't fried I would remember her name...ooops!) I was having a hard time deciding exactly which beer I wanted to drink and she gave me a sample of one (which was so tasty and yet I can't remember what it was. Perhaps I had too many beers!) I do remember the tasty cider on tap and I love when bars have a variety of cider to offer, especially if there's a cider on tap. My friend tried the pear cider in a bottle and that was really good as well. I started with the mussels for an appetizer and they were so yummy! Garlicky, buttery goodness. I don't think you can go wrong with anything that involves those ingredients! The green flash burger was awesome! Not my typical go to burger type but I was feel adventurous. I love that the new menu involves more gourmet type burgers. Looking forward to returning here on my next trip to Chicago in a few weeks and trying some more food and drinking more craft beers. This would become a regular spot for me if I still lived down the street!

I'm with the dissapointed folks below regarding the "new" Riverview.  RV was my go-to spot as well either with friends or with my daughters (that's where they learned to play Golden Tee, watched the Bears lose the Super Bowl, etc).  Food was solid, staff was friendly, etc.  Admittedly, it was due for a tune-up (the men's room was particularly beaten up) and could have used a tweaking of the menu but otherwise it was a great place to hang and we did often.  Was excited about the idea of new ownership in the sense of the foregoing (tune up/tweaked menu) and went last weekend with my girls.  While they did clean up the men's room, the remodel seemed to be simply: subtract pool table, add more TVs.  The menu did look good and they definitely upped the beer selection.  The waitress was perfecly nice, and the pretzel appetizer was actually quite decent.  The girls ordered burgers and I decided on the fish tacos.  Both of the burgers were woefully undercooked and my fish tacos, lets just say that they ruined the better part of my weekend. I understand that sh*t happens, but it was not the first impression I was hoping for.  I may yet give it another try, and I hope I have a better experience because it would really harsh my mellow if Riverview ceased to be a viable Roscoe Village bar option (love to the Village Tap regardless).

Living in the neighborhood, Riverview was my go-to spot for drinks and/or a  good bite to eat.  The staff was so friendly: I was on a first name basis with most of them. I was disappointed to learn the bar had closed and was re-opening with new owners, and had let all the old staff go. What a shame!! "What happened to Manny?" was my first question. Waitress said she'd been asked that very same question several times.   There are many craft beers listed, but none of the "hot" craft beers were on the new list. The food was on the lower end of bar food. I ordered the bleu cheese kobe burger...it came undercooked, with just a few mushrooms and barely any bleu on a pretzel roll, which was so doughy it took away from the sandwich. The meat was low quality. My husband ordered another burger dish highly recommended by our server, and he was disappointed even more. The other reviewer comparing these burgers to Kuma's must be joking. I miss the old RV hand-cut fries, so fresh and huge portions. New fries tasted overly-breaded. Gross. This place is a major let-down. While all the new tv's are a nice touch and the rehab is great, I am finding a new hangout spot.

Major letdown on the new Riverview!  A group of friends and I went there this past weekend, and the service/food was shotty.  We all ordered the grilled cheese, as the waiter said they were awesome. When we got our food, there was no cheese IN the sandwich....only a small slice. When I order grilled cheese, I expect cheese to be the main component of the dish....not the bread. We addressed the issue with our server, and he didn't even offer to remake the sandwich, or a refund. He just quickly gave us our check. You'd think that for only being open 2 days, they'd want to satisfy their first customers.  Unless things change, I see bad things ahead for this restaurant.  It's a shame, because it used to be our "go to" neighborhood spot.

I can not believe I am saying this. But Kumas, watch out. There's a new dog in town. For the past 5 years if I wanted a burger Kumas was the spot, hands down. But, Riverview which was my local watering hole until they ubruptly closed last month has reopened with new owners new menu new beers and some familiar faces! Craft beers A+, rehab A+ believe it or not this place looks good!! Food, I honestly had their version of a mastodon today and a mastodon at Kumas yesterday. Hands down, as much as it pains me, Riverveiw wins. 100% better. Kumas, you better raise the bar or the line will be out front of this place in 6 months.

NEW OWNERS=More expensive food with smaller portion sizes.  I've been going regularly to Riverview and Robey"s since moving to Roscoe Village over four years ago.  The old Riverview provided great value (large portions, great tasting food, and daily specials), the new Riverview doesn't live up to the old Riverview.  Specifically, the salads aren't as fresh and cost more (although the Robey salads are the same but cheaper).  The sandwich I ordered was all bread and little meat and the fries were heavily battered.  The service was good, but almost all of the staff is now new.  I will miss the old Riverview, including the Honeymooner sandwich, the daily specials, the former staff, and the awesome Robey's pizzas.

Went to Riverview for the first time since new owners. If you've been here before, get ready for a change.... for the worse! New menu is an attempt to be more 'fancy', yet they have paper menus??  You have to now wait to be seated which is an attempt to be more of a restaurant than a bar yet the atmosphere with the loud music and TV's is the exact opposite. Many of the great staples are no longer on the menu. Granted it's a brand new staff and there will be some growing pains but we waited FOREVER for our food only for my husband's food to be wrong. Riverview used to be our 'go to' place for a great, reliable meal however with the new ownership and changes, we will probably not be back. Very disappointed.

New owners = great food!  We went to Riverview today knowing that it was reopening.  The service was quick and friendly and the food really was good.  I got the buffalo chicken sandwich which was fried and in a great sauce with bleu cheese.  My dinner dates had a couple of different burgers which they raved about.  For starters we also had cheese curds, which if you've ever read any of my other reviews you know that I love.  These aimed to please with a great sauce for dipping.  I am excited to go back and try more of the menu. Have I mentioned that the beer list has improved dramatically?  Green Flash IPA!  Hooray!

RIVERVIEW is now CLOSED.  Yeah, you heard me folks.  They are under new management and will reopen in May.  That said, what will happen to the tasty burgers and fries?  Love this place in its former state.  I'm worried it will have lost it's edge.

I go to this place 2-3 times a month, for Team Trivia on Tuesdays. They have fair prices and a quality beer on special every month. I've had a variety of dishes, and usually I am satisfied but not much more. My friends have their dishes that they love (fish tacos), but this isn't food I would go out of my way to get. I do enjoy the atmosphere. It's friendly enough for families earlier on, and definitely fun for more late hour energy. They have a pool table and a Foosball table, great cushy seats that you wouldn't want to leave, and a good beer menu making this an all around good pub.

Adequate is a word that comes to mind to describe this pub-grub spot.. The server was super nice and the bartender noticed she was busy so came around and took our drink order to help out.. I give the place a little extra star action for that..  The food was what it should be but nothing special. We had paddy melts, fish and chips, and some fried apps.. This food could have came from any number of places in Chicago, its identical to many bars. I get the feeling its all ordered from the same distributor and when fried, of course its gonna be all the same. To make this different they need to add something with a little pizazz.. like more homemade stuff.. Since I do not live in Roscoe V, I likely will not be back and if I do find myself up in the area, I would probably try somewhere else.. I have had 10$ burgers at places that blew me away, this time it was just A-OK.
Good food, friendly waitstaff.  Their chorizo nachos are fantastic.  The only thing I was not impressed with was their chili.

I used to frequent Riverview when I lived in Roscoe Village - it really isn't anything special in regards to ambiance or food, but the service at this neighborhood bar is actually really great. Order whatever, but strike up a conversation with one of the bartenders or waitstaff, and you'll see what I mean. These super friendly guys and gals that remind me of why I love Chicago. I had a nice conversation with a bartender about Star Wars, prompted by the "Star Wars Trivia Night" advertisement outside one night. Another night, my friends and I needed a non-cray cray place to watch a Bulls game and ended up here. There weren't many people at the bar, and no one in the side room with the pool tables, but they opened it and turned on the TVs just for us. We were able to enjoy some cheap beers, food, and play pool while taking in a game. That's what I call a good night.

The service is hit or miss. There have been times I sit at an empty bar for five minutes before i'm acknowledged, and other times the server remembers what I had the last time I was there. The food is what keeps me coming back. Please, don't ever change the menu!!
The food is really good here.  However, the service is awful!  Been a couple times, and both of those times we had really negligent service.  I'd suggest take-out.
A go to place in the hood, amazing beer selection, the new owners are great, the food has been upgraded, and the staff are fantastic. Love what they did to this place.

Absolutely gross - I was served COLD black beans, hard - harddd, crunchy under cooked rice, and the most disgusting chicken taco I've ever had. The meat tasted really spongy and weird - complete with a bone roughly an inch wide, which I had to spit out - all served without hot sauce - which I had to ask for, to shield the food, as I needed to eat, to drink. Their sweet potato tater tots have a good flavor - but were not served crispy...they came out incredibly fast but clearly not fresh, prompting the obvious assumption that they'd been sitting under a heating lamp. So. Gross. The two stars are for a decent $4-5 draft list, with some seasonal brews, but DO NOT EAT HERE. And, as others have noted, the service is slow and inattentive.

Let me start off by saying, I use Yelp a lot for their reviews.  I will also say that the service at Riverview Tavern was so terrible, that I actually signed-up and made my own account so I could tell you about it.  We went there for dinner last night around 9:00 pm.  We sat outside and about 1/2 the tables were full so we figured it wouldn't take too long to eat.  We got menus pretty much right away and the waitress asked 1 minute later (when she brought our drinks) if we knew what we wanted, which we didn't, because we weren't familiar with the menu and needed some time to look at it.  BIG MISTAKE.  10 minutes pass, 20 minutes pass, the waitress is going to other tables, the bus boy is looking at us sympathetically, I even throw out a loud "excuse me" and she kept on walking.  About 30 minutes later she finally came over and I just handed her my credit card for the drinks and said we would be leaving.  She finally showed some hustle after I signed the receipt (first time IN MY LIFE that I have never left a tip) and she had the nerve to open up the book and see what her tip was while it was still on our table!  WHO DOES THAT??  Needless to say, we won't be going back.

Eh, nope.  There are bigger, better fish in the sea.   2 stars mostly for slow / inattentive service.  *on a slow/empty Friday evening.  - water served in plastic cups - wha?  why?  We weren't even sitting outside.      - one of our draft beers tasted weird, we sent it back. (I've never done that before).  Also, I ordered a 'vodka lemonade' and even though it tasted pretty good, I suspect there was zero booze in the supposed cocktail. - turkey burger was sub-mediocre; however, the sweet potato fries were great, I will give them that.  We live nearby this place so we wanted to give it a try, and although I loved the big mural inside of the old Riverview amusement park, and the nice low booths, there's nothing that makes me want to return here.

Riverview has been impressing me lately which is prompting this review.  I am not sure if they obtained a new chef, but I've been pretty impressed with the food lately.  Before (1 yr ago), I would leave disappointed after eating here.  The food just wasn't that good.  However, a good friend recommend their tacos.  Holy goodness....get some of these! They are all good....the fish, steak, and chicken mole. And fresh salsa and chips are always an appreciated side.   Personally, I don't enjoy hanging out inside of this bar.  It has an awkward layout and is a bit dark inside.  However, it's great in the summer.  They have several outdoor tables on an active street in Roscoe Village which lends itself to great people watching.  Also, the servers are attentive and extremely pleasant.

I went to Riverview Tavern for dinner with friends this past Friday night. I had been there several other times for work events but never just to grab a bite to eat. The menu was very diverse and it had a lot of good choices. I had 'The Comet' a veggie sandwich with a delicious cilantro pesto sauce on it. The sandwich was definitely yummy and the french fries were excellent. I also tried some of my friend's Shrimp Club wrap which I also thought was good.  The service was quick and efficient and I really enjoyed the outdoor seating as well. It was a positive experience and I really want to come back and try their brunch (I heard it's delicious).
Great staff, great atmosphere, good food. What a neighborhood bar should be.

Low key atmosphere, spacious interior, great servers and decent menu are just a few of the reasons that I love this place. They open at noon and are always ready to go for lunch. The menu is pretty typical pub fare, with good burgers and excellent fish and chips. On the weekends, there is a "hangover" menu with a mix of snacks and drinks.  The interior is spacious. A real change from so many crammed-to-the-gills tavern/grille establishments. They can easily accomodate large parties and very kid friendly. In fact, during the day this place is a haven for Roscoe Village parents. My mother loves the decor as they have several pieces of memorabilia from the old Riverview Amusement Park, which she remembers fondly from her childhood. If your parents are native Chicagoans and Baby Boomers, you might consider bringing them here for the nostalgia. The menu is typical pub fare. Burgers, wings, sandwiches. The chilli is good but my favorite is the fish and chips. It's all done well, though. They have a variety of trivia and game nights during the week. They host some great specials during sporting event. This is my default neighborhood place.

Mini corn dogs and mini pulled pork sandwiches... mmmmm it's like midget heaven in this joint. Don't worry though, not everything is mini, the mixed drinks were very generous the last time we went, so if you are a little person make sure you aren't driving.  This is our "go to" place if we're just hanging out with no plans, it's close to a friends place and the food and drinks are amazing. My mouth is watering just thinking about the mini pulled pork sandwich... but now I can't stop picturing a midget eating one so it appears normal size in my mind, but I assure you it's mini so order a couple of them.  The restaurant/bar itself is pretty big with a good amount of seating and plenty of room to move around. So if you're in the area with nowhere to go I would definitely recommend popping into Riverview for a quick bite and a drink.

Stopped by for the first time ever this past weekend to grab something quick to eat.  There was no one in the place(not a big deal).  Ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich w/cheese and a bag of BBQ chips.  The sandwich was really good, the chips were not that great.  I would definitely come back, but I would not order the chips. I plan on trying some pizza next time I go.

There every Tuesday for trivia and will continue to go back. Manny is great and so is the rest of the staff. While sometimes there aren't enough of them, they are always working to get your order. The chipotle black bean bbq burger is great along with the new selection of tacos. Robey's pizza is always a great choice as well.

I literally live around the corner from the place and had been very interested to try it.  I ordered a bacon cheeseburger and some hot wings.  I was definitely not impressed.  The quality of the burger just didn't impress me.  It tasted bland and the wings were way overcooked.  I will definitely give it another shot but lets just hope it doesn't dissapoint.  On  another note, my friend left her credit card one night after drinking.  When we went to pick it up they didn't even charge a tip after they had closed the bill as we had expected.  That is amazing and rare.  Needless to say, she received a great tip.
For a Saturday night the atmosphere is pretty great! Everyone was really nice, good food & service. I went with 2 other people & they were just as pleased. We'll be back!!! :)

The entrance is like walking into your own personal pub.  I felt very welcomed here and when I strolled randomly no one was bothered or interrupted so I watched the pool players and some friends and I got into the trivia game while watching the sports highlights over appetizers. Drinks weren't pushed on us and the boothes werent to close for comfort so we come back here a few times a year because the staff are cool and the food is served hot and promptly whether its a crowded day or not.

A local staple. Hungry?  Thirsty?  Not really sure what you want?  With a group of indecisive and/or passive people?  Head on over. Riverview is quite spacious - expanding outside when weather permits. There are several booths and - joy of joys - enormous tables for when you are traveling en masse. Odds are, there's space for you and your crew. Drink list? In addition to several on tap (including locals by Goose Island and Metropolitan), there's a longer list of bottles, wine, and mixed drinks. The food, while perhaps a touch predictable, is broad enough to cover many preferences and reliably tasty. Vegetarians shouldn't have a problem. Decent time for all.

This is a great place to go if you're looking for a neighborhood corner bar that has ample seating, and even has an outdoor area in the summer. I've been here for a quick dinner with the hubby, to have a leisurely dinner and drinks with an out-of-town friend, and as a place to meet up wtih a big group, and all the times have been great. I can only say good things about 2 of their sides/appetizers - the tater tots and the mini corn dogs. Yum! I've never had a burger or sandwich from this place, because the pizza is so good. Riverview is attached to Robey's, which is next door. I've tried a couple of their pizzas. My favorite is the Robey pizza, which is sausage, mushroom, and onions. The pizza along with the mini corn dogs are plenty for 2 to share. The drink specials are pretty good too. Service can be a bit on the slow side, but I've never been in a rush, so I've never minded.

PLAN YOUR PARTY HERE. We were looking for a place to have our daughter's first birthday and wanted to stay in our neighborhood (Roscoe Village). We had thrown an engagement party for some friends a few years ago and I had remembered good things but this party went off without a hitch. You can rent the front room for no fee, just a minimum order on food (which is easy to hit). The staff was great, they let us come early to set up and the food came in stages (like I had asked) so everyone was happy. The space was perfect for the weekend of the tourney with 3 big screen TV's on and the bartender Betty kept everyone happy. A very low-key but stress-free party for everyone who came, kids and adults and the food was great.

Went here on a Sunday afternoon for snacks and drinks. The service was mediocre.  The spinach and artichoke dip was good but could have come with a lot more pita bread.  If you're getting a mini buffalo chicken sandwich, beware that it will be the size of a chicken nugget.  Shots of Jameson are $4.  Nice place to check out if you are in the neighborhood.

The Riverview is a good neighborhood bar given the options currently in Roscoe Village.  It's a consistent place to get pretty good pub food and has a decent beer selection.  I would stick with the sandwiches and burgers here for the most part.  The black bean burger here is a very solid option - actually one of my favorite black bean burgers in the area.  The pizza on the menu is from Robey Pizza around the corner which is pretty good and is a nice option. They have team trivia night on Tuesdays and will occasionally run a Star Wars trivia night which gets insanely crowded.  If you are in the neighborhood it's a consistent place to go.

A nice little neighborhood bar that is very clean, has a good beer selection and provides solid food.  The burgers are pretty decent and they have sweet potato fries, which are damn good.  Sandwiches are hit or miss as they can either be really good or really dry.     This place is like an old trusty pair of jeans...it has a nice warm, inviting feel and it will never let you down as you know what to expect.  I just wish the TV's were not so spread out as it makes it difficult to watch more than 1 football game on a weekend afternoon, but I do like that it's rarely overcrowded.
5 stars for Tuesday trivia night and the most delicious tater tots I've ever had!
I'm a local and have been here quite a few times. I'm never disappointed or amazed. It's not bad for a quick bite or a few beers but I wouldn't hang out here all night.

Riverview Tavern is one of those places... I've never really had  bad time  --- but I've never really had the most amazing time of my life. It's never busy, the service is always good and the food is above average but not memorable. I'll come back out of convenience.

Great place in Roscoe Village to relax and have a few beers.  The bar area is really nice and comfortable and the Riverview Theme Park memorabilia on the walls is great.  Lots of history. I have been there a few times for dinner and the food is just average.  Just normal bar food.  The last time I was there I had a turkey burger (which was dry) and tater tots (which were very greasy). The only exception is the mini corn dogs appetizer.  They are delicious!

I LOVE this place. This food is great.. the beers and plentiful, and the staff is cool. Id give it 5 stars but.... Its a bar.. and every time I go in there I find myself surrounded by strollers and kids screaming and running around. Seriously people.. get a clue. Take the kids to chuck-e-cheese and stay out of Riverview. I dont need to hear them screaming and see them running around while Im trying to relax at one of my favorite places in Roscoe Village.

Great place to watch games and grab food anytime. They have a private back room that you can use (with a food minimum) that is great for small to medium sized events. Food is very good for a sports bar and good variety.

I walked into this place with my mom and it was very good. It was a Monday night, so I got a couple mini pulled pork and buffalo chicken sandwiches. They were sooooooooo good! Then we had a barbecue chicken pizza and that was really good as well.  We also had a hummus platter for an appetizer, which was great as well. Very good food in a nice, dank atmosphere.
went here to get some beer and watch the fsu game with my friend. it was perfect. beer specials were reasonable and the service was great.

This bar/tavern was on my "get to know my neighborhood" bar crawl/week long bender. I visited a lot of places around me just to get a feel for it. My group was one of three groups in the entire bar. This was at dinnertime (maybe a smidgen later). There were three servers and it still took about 10 minutes to get a beer. Followed by sitting and waiting for replacements. We ordered food which sounded really good by description, but turned out to be just mediocre (though not bad). Salty and greasy, perfect bar food, but small and low on meat. The tavern fries (which are covered in garlic and Parmesan) had no flavor beyond "fry" and still required ketchup to be edible. The tortilla chips were multicolored, and obviously came from separate bags. The regular were crunchy, the blue were soggy and the red was so stale as to be gummy.

I've lived around this neighborhood for a long time, and I've been to Riverview plenty of times. In the grand scheme of Chicago dining, I'd give it a solid 3 stars- maybe 3.5 on it's better days taking into account that it's a neighborhood joint.  Service is really hit or miss. Usually the servers and bartenders are attentive, though sometimes you do get an occasional bad apple. Their busboys are a little overattentive. I hate it when they try to take my plate before I am finished and I really really hate it when they reach for my plate without asking when I am finished but my company is not. I think it rushes my company and it drives me crazy. I understand that some people prefer a plate to be cleared as soon as they are finished regardless of whether their company is finished or not, but at least ask me.  I usually go with a beer when I'm here, but I've had mixed drinks as well. Standard Chicago prices with standard Chicago pours, but I never feel like a drink is too weak. They have a million TVs, and it's a relatively good size. It's seat yourself and I enjoy sitting outside on nice days and watching people on the nearby Roscoe and Damen intersection.  On to the food: This is hit or miss as well. I had the Robey pizza here once for a party. Worst. Pizza. Ever. (see separate review). I really like their hummus platter and the artichoke/spinich dip. I am not a fan of their salads. They are huge, but they are 95% lettuce. I've had the fish n chips, which was good and I enjoy their sandwiches. My favorites are the Honeymooner (turkey, swiss, bacon, spicy honey mustard) and Portabello and Pepper sandwich. I think their fries are gross, but their tots are usually perfect. They're worth the upgrade.

I just went again to Riverview to spend my Groupon, and have dinner out on the patio.  We went on a warm Wednesday, and there were plenty of outdoor seats available.  Since we had a Groupon, we pretty much went to town.  While everything we ate this time was superior to what we ate last time, it still wasn't enough to boost the rating to four stars.  sooooorry. BUT - I loved the spinach dip because it was incredibly cheesy and hot, and delicious with the toasted pita triangles.  Had a few noms of my boyfriend's turkey reuben, which wasn't bad.  His fries were average, just like last time.  I got the mango-avocado salad which was pretty fresh, I had to say, and better than you'd expect at a bar.  We also got two mini BBQ sliders which were okay, but very sweet and sugary tasting.  Also enjoyed my can of Strongbow!   It's a place that's pretty average across the board - some ups, some downs, and they balance each other out.  It was a nice place to visit, while we lived in the neighborhood!  Very friendly servers too.

Food, okay.  Lots of TVs.  Lots of sports.  Pizza from Robey's.  What keeps me from going back (and reminds me when I forget,) is how LOUD I have to talk when I'm there.  BAAAAD acoustics.  I've yet to sample the full selection of beers, but I might take it outside so I don't have to YELL to be heard beyond 2 feet.  (Its not the best indoors place if you want to have a personable conversation with someone.

Not an overwhelmingly amazing experience. The service left a lot of be desired. I probably could have downed a few more beers if my glass hadn't sat empty for so long. Karaoke on Thursday nights makes for interesting conversation. The food is average (although, we were impressed with the hummus platter that is very large for $6.95). Overall, there are places to get a better meal with better service, but Riverview will do in a pinch.

Used my groupon here, and I'm glad I didn't pay full price for the food, lemme tell ya! The atmosphere was nice and beers were good and plentiful, but the chicken quesadilla and chicken teriyaki sandwich that we ordered were awful! The tater tots were pretty awesome, but how can you mess up tots? I know it's just bar food, but it was less than average.

Riverview Tavern IS my favorite place to eat, drink, and socialize in Roscoe Village! The atmosphere is fun and cozy and I love their music selection. If you're not crazy about what they are playing on the speakers, it's no big deal. Just go over to the juke box and change it to your favorite Hall and Oates hit or pop favorite.  Music and coziness aside, the best thing about Riverview is the staff. Everyone who works there is kind, friendly, and they remember all of their repeat customers. I always know I'll have excellent service when we get the waitress in the fedora (you'll know who I mean) as our server! Not only is she friendly but she always makes sure our beer is refilled and our food is ordered. Also, don't forget to say hello to the bartender on Wednesday and Friday nights. He's very charming! I recommend the loaded tater tots (don't worry if they're not on the menu, you can still get them) and the summer tacos with chicken. The pizza at the connecting Robey Pizzeria also never disappoints. Overall, Riverview is a great place to go if you want a quick bite to eat or a casual drink with friends.

I went with my husband and kids, and had a fabulous time!  I probably loved it because I went on a Wednesday, when they have $3 appetizers (excludes wings).  You could definitely get full on a few of those, and I just love appetizers.  We got chicken fingers, spinach artichoke dip and mini corn dogs, which was plenty for our toddler boys to fill up on while we still got to snack.  I ordered a patty melt and my husband got a cajun avacado turkey club.  We both really liked our meals, I couldn't finish my sandwich and I barely touched my fries.  I was very pregnant at the time, so, believe me, not finishing a meal is quite uncommon.  We also got a couple of sodas and a cupcake for dessert.  If you go on a Wednesday you can leave stuffed with good food for not too much, and it's a nice, clean, fun atmosphere.  Plenty of close, free parking.  Spent $18 using a  restaurant.com  coupon.

Any local place with a patio just count me in. I checked out Riverview and sat outside, service was great he was very attentive although I can't recall his name.  Also, think it was a great idea to have Robey's pizza on their menu - guess it's the same owner. A must is the Tomato Basil pizza.

I agree with Jenny R's assessment that this place is  "miraculously median."  Went here with a couple of friends to watch the game and was happy that there were places to sit at the bar. The bartender was great and made sure our beer glasses remained topped off, but the food and the atmosphere of the place were really nothing special. To sum up, there wasn't anything spectacular about this place, but there was nothing that was terrible either.

I was craving a big ol' salad (a "Big Salad," if you will) and my Dad recommended we go to the Riverview, where he said the salads are "da bomb."  (He, uh... he's one of "those" dads.  Wiggity-wack-tore-up-from-the-floor-up-do-the-kids-still-say-"Boss" Dads.  And I love him.) We arrived and were instructed to seat ourselves.  We all ordered water, and I was immediately put off by the fact that they give you plastic cups for water... the cheapy, translucent step-down-from-Solo kind.  Am I at a movie theatre?  This is a bar, is the cost of washing one more glass so high compared to disposable cups that you're willing to let the environment take one for the team? Our waitress was nice enough, but she had a weird habit of pointing at the person she was speaking to, and she seemed to be covering the entire place on her own.  She walked quickly with her head down, and it was therefore nearly impossible to track her down, even when we should have been rightly in her line of vision.   We ordered the hummus plate (on $3 special, bonus), but when it came out, it was spinach dip.  The mistake was corrected, but the spinach dip also managed to sneak its way onto our bill later.  When my salad came out, it had the wrong dressing attached, and it took more than 5 minutes to track someone down to have it fixed (with my Dad eventually solving the problem by waving a hand in the air like he just don't care).  However, I didn't like the dressing I ordered ("avocado ranch" tasted like slaw dressing) or the one that came with it (salsa vinaigrette was meh), so I ordered some standard ranch and it tasted like it came from a Kraft bottle. The way they do their salads is smart, with a base price per salad and then "add a protein" for an additional charge.  But the menu said "grilled chicken," which a reasonable person would expect to mean that when you order, they will grill chicken and slap it up on your salad.  But the chicken was cold and dry as opposed to hot and juicy and had clearly been cooked hours earlier and thrown into a container to be added to salads later.  Honestly, it was pretty gross.  My Mom's salad had shrimp, and it was hot and delicious, which made me a little jealous. All in all, not a super great experience.  Especially considering my salad was $11, most definitely not worth the price.  Maybe I should stick to the deep-fried bar snacks, but considering it's not exactly in the neighborhood, I don't see much incentive to return...

When I lived in Roscoe Village back in the day, we thought this place was THE SHIT. Maybe because we were newly out of college and it was one of the first places we went where everyone was actually over 21....or maybe because we liked sitting on the sidewalk drinking beer, or maybe it was just the close proximity to out place. Whatever it was, the feeling is long gone.  What happened Riverview?  We'll examine the service first:  It was the Wednesday before St Patrick's day so it was a little busy but definitely not busy enough for us to have to wait 10min before even getting greeted with menus! We weren't asked for drinks when the menus came just told to hold on. Our waitress who shall be known as "Snooki" for the rest of this review, was nice but clearly unable to manage all of her table.  On to the food:  DO NOT order the Potato Skins - burnt to a crisp along the edges. The burnt taste overpowered the taste of the potato and fixins. We didn't even finish the last one and we ALWAYS clear out plates! - they use over-sized potatoes which is weird...maybe they thought it was cool??  I had a turkey wrap. It was grilled....um....gross? It's like they put the whole wrap in the middle of a foreman and then served it up. LOL, no thanks. At least not without my permission.  Snooks was real sweet the whole time though, and once we got the ball rolling the food came pretty quickly and she kept the water glasses full. I guess there's an upside to every experience.  Naw.

Your typical bar with typical bar food. When we arrived, I think it may have been understaffed.  We were told to seat ourselves.  The only available booth had the remnants of a previous meal scattered on the table.  We sat down and an employee removed the old cups and plates and wiped the table. Our server was pleasant enough, but she wasn't the one to bring out our food.  Someone else hustled the meal to our table, but he brought an incorrect entree.  He ran back and got the right dish and we were finally ready to roll. I ordered the Midway Burger, essentially a straight-up hamburger with no frills.  It was good.  The fries were also solidly yummy. I had to track down mustard from a nearby table since the guy who brought the food rushed off before I had a chance to ask him for it. So the food was good, the atmosphere was fine, but the service was lacking.  I don't really fault any one person.  It just seemed like when you have that few people patrolling that many tables, some things are bound to fall through the cracks.

Somehow, even the Potato Skin appetizer was bland.  Everything was underwhelming and kind of yucky.  I was really hoping for better.  Cute location, might be good for meeting someone for a beer, but you can have a much better dinner in the neighborhood.

Positively middle of the road experience and yet another one of the establishments in my neighborhood that somehow fails to wow me.  While the history that Riverview Tavern proudly upholds of what was once (back in 1904) Chicago's only amusement park - and the "World's Largest" - is impressive and undeniable, the overall vibe here is pretty basic. Think positively typical neighborhood bar-cum-restaurant in every way... large wood bar, a smattering of booths, rickety tables with wood chairs, somewhat apathetic service, pub-type grub... the formula surely works for grabbing a brew and watching your game of choice via copious flatscreen - as I did this evening - but high expectations for much else should be checked at the ticket booth.  A shining beacon is certainly all the signage nostalgia from the roller coasters, fortune tellers, food vendors and even 'the parachute jump'... a neat flashback to our city's illustrious past, indeed and absolutely fun to dine by. Burgers and sandwiches are in plenty here as well as a few salads and pizza options from the next-door Robey Pizza Co. Stick to Riverview's items done well like juicy hot wings, meaty chili burgers and crunchy tater tots (mmmm....tots!) and you'll do just fine. Try to get fancy with healthier fare and you're left despondently picking at a dry grilled chicken breast and accompaniment of cold, undressed green beans. Barf.  While we're definitely all tall enough to enjoy this version of Riverview's rides, the adrenaline rush you'll find is a lot less Dare Devil Dive and a bit more Sammy's Slow Spinner. Just sayin'.

Our waitress was super friendly and cute,so bonus points for that. i thought i wanted a burger but revamped my opnion with the sight of the pulled pork sandwich. It wwas big,and i got tater tots with it! I would have liked coldslaw, but thats just me being picky. So yeah, very very good sandwich, and fun little place to drink and watch sports!

Once upon a time Riverview Tavern had two dartboards in the backroom where you could shoot darts and pass the time by quickly. These days they took the cork dartboards away and put a pool table by it. With my primary objective Friday night to be darts, it was best for me and my bud to go in, make an order, and head out to meet our other friends already in dart progress. We went inside and checked out the menu in the back room and went to the front room to make our order. It took awhile for the bartender to come on out but it was understandable given that it's Friday night and the whole place was jammed with Roscoe Village denizens. Plenty of good looking folks and the Blackhawks game was overhead on the TVs so we could get a clear view of them taking out Vancouver in devastating fashion! The bartender brought us our checks but the pens did not work much to my chagrin. Me and my buddy stood at the bar for about 20 minutes until our food finally arrived and we bounced out of there quickly to get to dart practice. Opening up the food, I found the Silver Platter burger worth every cent and it was a giant rollercoaster of bacon, cheese, mushrooms, caramelized onion and juiciness. It really was a MONSTER. The fries were cut thin with skins on and tasted superb with the proper crisp needed. Great place for eats, drinks and to watch the game. However if you are looking for darts - they don't have them anymore!!!

Come to Riverview Tavern on a Tuesday night be prepared for one thing, and one thing only:  a severe and utter trivia beat down by Answers In Your Pantswers...or not, we've only won once, but it's a heck of a lot of fun nonetheless. Even though Riverview Tavern is only a block away from me, it's not a place I frequent, save for Trivia Tuesdays (when I'm not in grad school).  The trivia is free, the degree of difficulty ranging from fairly simple to an occasional headscratcher, and the prizes, well, it can range on tickets to see YES one week, to a simple $25 gift certificate the next, so you never really know. The service is generally friendly and attentive, although you can become a bit lost for service if you sit in the back area instead of up front.  And while my drinks always seem to be swapped (A whiskey diet becomes a whiskey ginger and vice versa) I won't complain too much because in general they come with a pretty decent pour.   The food is what really makes Riverview stand out.  Their turkey burger is one of the best that I've had in the city and you can't go wrong with any of their chicken sandwiches, just be sure to get a side of their chipotle mayo for your fries or tots!

My roommate and I went to Rivewview for dinner since it's only a couple blocks from our apt and we were looking for a place to watch the Hawks.  All in all, it's a decent place but I think I'll try somewhere else in the area next time. The decor and theme of the restaurant is very cool.  It has all sorts of pictures and memorabilia from the old Riverview Park.  I wasn't alive when it was around, but I've heard countless stories from my dad about Riverview and it was fun to see pictures of the rides.  Some of the menu items are named after the rides, which I thought was cool. The service was so-so.  The waiter was good in the beginning, but once we got our food, he was nowhere to be found.  Not sure if it's the waiter or bartender, but the drinks came out slow as well.  Notably, it wasn't very busy there so I'm not sure what the deal was. I had the patty melt which looked pretty good.  I ordered it medium well, it came out barely medium.  I don't send food back, so I ate it anyway and it was just okay.  The chips and salsa were nothing to write home about.  Both my roommate and I ordered a beer from the menu, but they actually didn't have them on tap (I've been craving a Summit Heffe for a while), so we had something else.

Neat decor, beer, and beer.  Also, beer.  The food, though?  Eh.  Not so great.  I don't expect a 4 star meal at a pub, but this isn't even good for pub food in most cases.  We come back because it's near work, they serve beer before 5pm (so we can play hookey and grab a drink after long weeks), and there's always available seating.  Not bad, but not great.

I've only been for their well-advertised brunch and it was ok.  They were short-staffed, which made it tough to love it.  The menu was a little weak and the mimosas were a tad overpriced.  The food was really good though and the place has a really cool feel.  We are going to try it again...just maybe not for brunch.

What river? What view?  Misnomer aside, I was pretty disappointed with this place. I'd been by so many times in the summer months and spied what looked like very tasty dishes on people's outdoor tables. I finally had the chance to go in and give it a try on a snowy February night.  The service was horrible. There were only three or four other tables with customers at the time. I'm not sure what the hold up was or why we were ignored, but the waiter continuously just kept walking by, avoiding eye contact.  The food was mediocre at best. Having seen what I thought were delectable salads, I ordered the Santa Fe salad. It was bland with few ingredients other than lettuce. The salsa dressing was also pretty tasteless. My companion had a turkey burger that was completely "meh."  I wanted to like you Riverview Tavern. But you fell short.

Decent food, below average service usually, above average TV/sports coverage, decent atmosphere, decent prices.  Nothing sucks about this place, but really nothing is interesting about this place (except maybe the USA vs.Russia domed hockey arcade game in the back).

I can walk here from my house.  The food is decent, though I was here on a Saturday afternoon once during March Madness and couldn't get over the clientale.  Yeah, I'm one of few who refuse to pay for cable... So have to goto bars for games... yeah, that's my story..   Anyway... Strollers everywhere.  But I guess that comes with the Roscoe Village neighborhood.  I didn't dare to cuss that my team was about to be eliminated....  so I just sat there, drank my Blue Moons in silence so I didn't wake the babies.....

I met a friend from school here to borrow a book....the location was a good midway point for us. The service was great.  The beer was a little high, but the service more than makes up for it.  It's exactly what I would expect from the outside, though more children than I would expect...that's the 'hood though.  (This doesn't bother me, but I thought others would like to know.)   I'll come again.

Decent place. Not many people in there so it's easy to find a place to sit. Riverview has a good beer selection and some martinis as well which I'm all about but have yet to try any of tem. Their food is pretty good. My favorite item is the shrimp wrap. It has bacon, avocado and chipotle mayo. Fatty, but delicious. Not a fan of their grilled cheese but their nachos are also good. This place is nothing extraordinary but a good place to eat and get some drinks if you live in the neighborhood.

Tried it a few times, not a top pick. The wait staff is pretty bad, except for one waitress. They don't do hardly anything but ask if your food is okay. The people bringing the food and refills are the bar backs, and I always want to tip them and not the waitress. The food is decent, but overpriced for what it is, which is run-of-the-mill bar burgers. The menu is also pretty small, which makes it hard to be a repeat customer. My girlfriend does like the Vegetarian options and they have a lot of seating and TVs to watch the game, so that's nice. I'd give them more stars if I could get reliable service and a better price.

Look, like the pal before me said - this place is nothing special. But for a neighborhood bar & grill, it's absolutely A-OK.  The best things about it, to me, are: you can always get a seat, the service is great (based on three visits, but mostly inspired from my most recent visit!), the turkey burger is spot-on (and at $8, priced just right), and there is always street parking.  What this place isn't: it's not an over-packed sports bar. It's not a pub with an impressive beer menu. I've never seen any gentleman eye candy. It's just not that awesome.  But for a nonsense outing in the neighborhood, it's definitely worth a visit. And I hope you get the lovely server we had!

Definitely a solid place to grab a bite to eat or watch a game.  Great menu, I really like the Quattro Stagioni pizza.  Prices are very reasonable and I have never left feeling annoyed or ripped off :)

Bah, bah I say!!!  All this place has going for it is the location.  Our Tuesday night softball league is sponsored by these clowns, and 2 games into the season our whole team wishes we never made the switch from McGees (although they had issues too, more to come later).  The food is average at best.  The chicken sandwich is dry and comes with nothing on it, and the chicken quesadillas were so bad I didn't even eat 1/2 the plate!  And I was buzzed and starving!  They do offer tator tots as a sub instead of fries, but seriously, who screws up tator tots.  Being a Tuesday night, the place is rather empty which is fine.  But they have trivia night on Tuesday nights and the MC 'hollas' over the mic as if he is in a banquet hall full of senior citizens.  Terribly annoying if you're not one of the 6 people playing.  We had about 10 people in our group, and since it was empty and they DO sponsor us, we figured we'd get half decent service.  NOPE!  Not only did they not give us a free round of water-downed shots for our victory, they rarely if ever came to our table.  Huh?  Do people not want to make money?  When a couple people approached the manager about the whole scenario, all that was said was "maybe you should find another bar then."  We will you prick, we will.  Cram your tators tots where the sun doesn't shine!

Riverview has a great menu selection. I love the tuna melt or reuben sandwich. And they have tater tots! They also have ample seating (outdoor seating in the summer) and a decent beer selection. They just started serving "brunch", but that menu looks limited (full menu is also available).

This place is nothing special.  I'd say it is on the lower end of 3 stars.  possibly even 2 stars but I'm feeling pretty generous.  It is usually not crowded, I like room but I want some people around damnit. The beers were kind of more expensive than I would have guessed.  They were more expensive than the Hop Leaf for some of their 'better' beers I still remember one time I went there with my wife and a friend of mine from work.  Some guys tried hitting on my friend.  They bought her a shot and she goes up to them to talk.  Then they all got scared to talk and when she asked who got her the shot they responded it was more of a group effort.  I thought it was pretty funny that a group had to each pich in like $0.50 to buy a hot for a girl they don't know.

I've been here a couple of times but just because of conveniance.  I can't ever seem to find anything on the menu that I really want to try so always end up going with the grilled cheese (classic standby). I do like the mini corn dogs as an appetizer though. Along with what's said in other reviews, Riverview has mediocre service. Even when not that busy, servers don't seem to come around much...

I've ate here a number of times basically because it is within a 5 minute walk  from my house. While the food is okay, the service is always extremely slow. Being a server myself I understand if someone is attending to 10 tables at once, it is difficult. However, managers and owners know peak times for their business, they should be prepared with adequate staffing.  Overall, it's alright, sometimes a wee bit too loud and you have to shout to speak to the server or whoever is with you at your table.  I'll probably keep going back because their hummus is pretty good, but I get it to go most of the time.

This was a great bar to go to after a softball game.  The sweet potato fries were excellent, and I really liked the avocado dipping sauce.  I also liked that you could order warm pretzels for an appetizer!  Unique touch!  We also had great service with our big group.  Well done, Riverview!

We ate at Riverview this past Sunday for lunch. We both had cheeseburgers and fries. The burgers were most likely a pre-made frozen patty. It just had that uniformity when I bit in -- no crumbling of delicious ground beef. It was also ridiculously greasy. Delicious, but oozing grease. It took me at least 6 napkins to eat this thing. The fries were handcut and really crispy. Yum! The bar seemed like a cool spot, and I'd like to go back with a group and sit at one of those big tables in the middle.

It's apparently impossible to get a patty melt with Swiss cheese cooked medium.  Chicago being such a foodie capital, home of so much good food the transition of moving to the Midwest has been relatively painless.  But I digress, the rye bread was wonderfully toasted, and the french fries, muah!  Once again showing Horizon Cafe how it's done!  Even though the burger was overdone and the service spotty (One person cannot take care of a busy bar and floor) it's clean, and the beer is cold.

We go to Riverview every Tuesday night for Trivia, and I must say, I'm not very impressed. There isn't anything very exciting about the place, and the food isn't anything to write home about. I have tried the grilled cheese (average), burgers (they have a good variety, but nothing stood out to me), and appetizers (ordinary). All of the salads are pretty overpriced, any time you add chicken or steak, it's automatically over $10.  I give them a star for their monthly beer specials, like 312 and Shocktop, but I think better bar food is found elsewhere. However, their pizza menu is fantastic. They make the pizza next door (forgot the name of the business) and it's phenomenal. Order the BBQ Chicken and you won't be disappointed.

Very average Chicago bar/tavern. Nothing special at all. The chicken fingers were actually good. The menu selection was very low. I love outdoor dining but it's just TOO loud.  I really enjoy all the new updated bars with fun menus and great drinks. This just isn't my type of place but if you like the good ole taverns give it a try!

I'm on the fence with this one, and would like to give it a 2.5.   Food was pretty good for bar food, especially the portabello and pepper sandwich.  I was pleased with the variety too, especially the vegetarian options.  It took me a few minutes to make up my mind because I had so many options.  The interior is comfortable, and the outdoor seating is nice too.  Music varied between 90s alternative to craptastic disco.  Our server was the low-point of coming here.  Water and soda glasses were left empty, we were not checked in on after the food came, and because his shift was over, he asked us if we could hurry up so he could close out our tab.  Not cool.   I'd go back if I was in the area, but would not go out of my way.

not a bad bar, but i tried the chicken fingers and they were pretty much inedible. clearly came straight from the freezer and reminded me of cafeteria food. my fiance got the cheese fries. the cheese was extremely runny which was troubling but surprisingly tasted kind of good. i would recommend going here to drink, not eat. one tip if you like red bull/vodka... this is the place to go because they give you a full pint glass rather than a regular mixed drink glass. it's a good deal.

Not a bad spot to meet up with friends for some drinks. The beer selection leaves a lot to be desired, but the liquor drinks are decent. The food is average at best, and the chicken tenders were edible but tasted like they came straight out of the freezer...

I tend to go this place after random spring snowstorms. I met some friends here for some basketball and beer. The place was fairly empty but enjoyable. The TVs were strategically placed. And the food was reasonably priced and offered plenty of choices. Definetely a great neighborhood bar.

Decent tavern serving burgers and such.  The bar gets a little rowdy, but a fun looking crowd.  It has nice lighting & you can get tater tots with your sammich or burger.  A pretty good place!  I'll visit again soon.

my friend recently had her bday shindig here. the place was pretty cool, they had food and it was decent. their spinach and cheese quesadilla was pretty good as was the chicken skewer. they have 312 on tap and i always appreciate that since it's like one of very few beers that i like. overall,  a pretty solid place

This place would get five stars solely based upon the fact that they are the official Florida State bar in Chicago. It's so difficult to see Bobby and the Criminals anywhere in this city. Unfortunately, my experience here was completely ruined by the obnoxiously loud music.  LOUD MUSIC.  LOUD MUSIC.  MY EARS ARE BLEEDING.  Did you hear me? Probably not because you've lost you're hearing.  I will never, ever return as long as the music makes me eardrums feel like they are being smashed with a hammer.

Decent sized place if you can ever figure out which door lets you in.  Big cozy booths with pretty fast service.  Drink specials are decent, even on Saturday but wine selection blows. Menu is typical bar food but there were some yummy options and I recall loving some pretzel thing.  Sandwiches are decent as well.

I've been here a few times for drinks and it's been OK. Had lunch there with the family last month and wasn't too good. Was hoping it was an off day so I stopped by for a buffalo chicken sandwicha and a beer. Well again, the food was terrible. It tasted like it was cooked yesterday and reheated. So good place to drink, bad place to eat. At least the staff is friendly.

Came here for lunch and had a fabulous experience.  The ice tea is not from the gun, but is the really good Republic Darjeeling Tea.  Food was out in less than 15 mins.  Excellent sandwiches.  Great service.  Some of the best bar food around!

I came here yesterday with the exquisite Maggie R and Jessica R.  It takes a special kind of bar to be able to start drinking at 3pm with no judgement - and Riverview is that bar. When we arrived there was hardly anyone in there, but by the time we peeled ourselves off our barstools there was a good crowd going. Drinks were well poured, food was pretty good, service was awesome.  Win, win, win.  Oh, and the manager bought us a round of drinks.  Win.

Um, about the flack for the weird carnival murals and memorabilia... obviously those reviewers are not from Chicago. Riverview was a huge amusement park that died out back in the 60's and was pretty well known. I even had to do a history fair project about it in the 3rd grade (ahhh...nostalgia). So, yeah pretty self explanatory. But, back to the bar... It's your standard bar. I'd like to point out that the bathrooms were clean every time I've gone,weird to point out I know, but I've noticed some complaints. The service is always good. I do know one of the bartenders but he definitely doesn't cater to us when we go. He's just a good bartender. They also have Fat Tire on tap. Woo hoo! Also, it's always been pretty quiet when I've gone during the week so I'm actually surprised to read that it's a pretty happenin spot. Go...don't go, I won't be offended either way. It's definitely not a destination spot though. If you're in the neighborhood, stop in for some cheap drinks at an average place. I don't think you'll be disappointed but don't expect to be wowed.

I have been coming here for years, and have always had a good experience. I just recently went in for the first time in about a year. The food was still good...service was nice as well. I highly recommend the portobello sandwich. The manager, Jon, bought us a round of drinks, which was very sweet. I always have, and still enjoy this place. I have never been here on a weekend night, but in the middle of the afternoon, it is super conducive to midday drunkenness. Btw, the blond bartender was awesome and partook in dog-convo with us. Holler.

Meh... this place is just meh.  I don't understand it at all. There are weird carnival murals painted on the walls.  The dining rooms are way to dark and this are spilt out in an odd manner.  There are large tall tables in the center of the dining room. The men's bathroom looks like something out of a Saw movie.  All in all this place is set up poorly.   The food is typical bar food; overpriced wraps, soggy fries and unhealthy appetizers.  The only positive is the beer selection.  like i said this place is Meh.

Sad the old Riverview of family home movies lives on in the form of this. We went in one night for a chill time. Some dudes with popped collars were getting into an argument outside. The toilet in the men's room wasn't bolted to the floor and when it was flushed, everything in the bowl came on the floor.
Only went here for *a* beer & it was a quick one at that, but from what I could tell, it seemed like a pretty decent place.  I'll write more when I come back for a second try.

I'm giving Riverview a solid 3 stars, since I'm the only one out of the party of 3 to have a drink. The door guy looks like he stepped out of an Abercrombie catalog...just a tip ladies. Anyway, the two bartenders were super friendly. We had a great time joking and laughing with them! I had a vodka tonic, nothing special, but a pretty darn good vodka tonic. Oh! On Sundays, the staff purposefully tries to play the lamest music ever, so beware! I definitely want to go back to try the pizza. The couple next to us at the bar had the tastiest looking pizza ever!

5 stars for our server dealing with the 2 surly out-of-towners in our group 4 stars for the food and beer selection 1 star for the bathrooms being out of paper towels and having a broken hand dryer We headed over to Riverview after Retro on Roscoe for a drink and some food. It took us a while to flag down a server, but in her defense it was pretty crowded. I was a little worried because she didn't write down our order and we didn't order straight off the menu, but she proved my inner-cynic wrong and got our order perfect. The bathrooms could've been in better shape, but I have pretty low expectations when it comes to sports bar bathrooms and this was definitely one of the better ones, especially with the size of the crowd. I'll definitely be back here, hopefully when I do our server will have forgotten the obnoxious out-of-towners in our party. (When is it appropriate to bang on the window and SCREAM at our table "where's my boyfriend?" Especially when you have a perfectly good cell phone in your hand) If they had been my houseguests, they would've gotten a serious talkin' to when we got home!

So I haven't been here in about a year but I must have been here a hundred times when I lived in Roscoe Village.  This place was halfway between my place and my brothers, and a perfect location to meet, as pre-smoking ban, this was the only non super smoky location on the Roscoe Village strip.   First I will repeat the amount of time I spent here, I was probably there 2-3 times a week for food, drink or both.  However, the servers never recognized us, remembered our drinks, or even a little nicer to us.  This is just not my experience at places where you are a regular.  The servers are all nice but for the most part, not quick on their feet and the service was always touch and go.  My old roommate dubbed it as the place "where no one knows your name."  My brother and I would joke about our lack of attention as regulars. The food here is pretty good.  It is pretty much just sandwiches with cute names taken from Rides from the old Riverview amusement park.   Some are just so good, such as The Bobs, which is their chili burger.  They give you a ton of fries which you can sub out for salad or mashed potatoes.  They also have a beer of the month and weekly specials for food.   The bar scene here is a little weak but is fine for a neighborhood bar.  The juke box takes credit cards which meant that some I would always place some Prince, Logins and Messina, or some other garbage there.   Over all, if you want a nice, clean and laid back place for a beer or a sandwich or both, this is a great location, just don't expect the server to remember your name.

I stopped in here to waste some time while waiting for someone. I don't think I've ever felt so unwelcome at a bar before.  This dude with a nose ring (whom I believe is a manager) was very rude to me and pretty standoffish. It's like, you're a guy with a nose ring, how dare you act like you are better than me, ya know?

What is the best way to spend sidewalk money? Buy beer, of course! I found a crisp twenty on the sidewalk last evening and did a happy antsy dance.  I usually find pennies and dimes, never the paper kind, so this called for a celebration.   Although Drew gave a generous 4 stars, I'm sticking with a solid 3 stars.  We just had some beers so I can't comment on food.  I'd come back to give their grilled cheese a try sometime :) It was indeed a perfect summer evening and we did have a great server giving us our ice cold brews.  Thank you sidewalk money!

I we hadn't found a 20 on the street an hour earlier and if it hadn't been an absolutely perfect 75 and breezy night maybe the Riverview Tavern wouldn't get 4 stars.   They do have some 7 beers on tap, prodigious outdoor seating and most wonderfully serve a huge carafe of ice water when you sit down. Service was a little slow but there was only one (very nice) waitress facilitating the whole sidewalk.  Didn't try the food but it looked like standard bar fare/standard bar prices.

My first, and main issue with this place is: Why do they call it Riverview Tavern? It's a pretty long hike to the river from there. And before the other reviewers give me sass, I did my homework (thanks Google) and learned about Riverview park, which is neat and cute and all, but seriously, change the name. History is old. The future is new. So anyway, minus 1 star there. Then there was this thing at the bar where my friend ordered some Maker's Mark, but they had to give him Beam 'cause they were out. And even though he asked if it was cheaper, they still charged him the same. But (SPOILER WARNING) Jim Beam IS cheaper than Maker's Mark. So they should have comped him the drink or at least not been awkward. So minus another star there. The draft special was good price -- at the time I went it was Goose Island Summer Ale. Four pints of those took me to the mat really quick. So plus a star on beer prices. I have to take off one more star because the crowd was just so-so. I was there with a few friends which definitely made for a good time, but otherwise the patrons consist of people who don't look like they know what they're doing. Like if you had a bunch of friends in town and they all wanted to go somewhere different you might take 'em here just because nobody can complain if you at least go somewhere. And the next morning, you're like, eh -- it was okay. That sums it up: just okay. PS: I didn't have any of the food but it smelled good.

I have a huge bias....pool tables or at least one. So I automatically liked this place.  BTW...did anyone find the owner of the orange cat hanging outside? Cute bar...I like the three phases of it: The little seating area where you can grab a bite, the bar where you can be a bar head, and the back where you can shoot some stick.  How many mirrors can you fit inside a girls' bathroom? That is the question.

Usually I am not a fan of the semi-fancy grilled cheese, and by this I only mean grilled cheese on thicker bread, sometimes involving tomatoes. I find these to usually be lacking in something the kids menu kraft singles grilled cheese sandwiches (dipped in ketchup) of my youth always had. Maybe it was grease, maybe it was just my immature palate. Without wanting to make the Riverside grilled cheese sound unnecessarily artery-clogging (as I don't believe it is), it properly welcomed me into adult-hood grilled cheese sandwiches with just the right amount of melty melty cheese and butter (and I didn't even pick the tomatoes out!) The fries sat next to it, offering a little bit of recognizable comfort in case the thicker cut bread (with those holes fancy bread gets) became too intimidating. The fries are the type that get kinda crunchy crispy on the outside, like onion rings at times, but still remained very much in the realm of potato products. Not those gross pale-yellow sogfests that some restaurants serve. We sat outside, which was really lovely except after 11 they make you move inside. City ordinance, not their fault, but kind of shuts the party down. The beer selection is pretty good, I just had Blue Moon and my friends had 312, but I think I saw they had a few other interesting things. Nothing too out of the way, but you won't be crying because all you can get is Miller Lite or Guinness.  Finally, a few nights ago the bartender bought my friend a drink cause it was her college graduation. Good service!

I really love the Santa Fe Salad, with Chicken and ranch instead of the crap they give you... They always seem to have a decent beer of the month, and a great juke box.  Dock on star for the crappy fries.

Tater tots!  Tater tots!! Tater tots!!! Decent food in a spacious atmosphere (I haven't been there on a crowded night yet - more of a lunch patron) and I'm a nut for Riverview Amusement Park history; so walking around and looking at the toys, maps, old signs is always a good time for me. I can't say enough about the tater tots though.

Very good food, but it is a little pricey for standard bar fare. Granted, the food is some of the best bar food you can get, but it still seems a bit high. Especially when you factor in beer prices. Sunday's during football season you may want to go somewhere else since it tends to get pretty crowded and you may have to really search to find a tv with with game you want.

The Riverview can get a little noisy when the TVs are turned too loud but you have to keep in mind it's a pub setting.  Also, the outdoor sitting area can also get a little noisy and fumey in the summertime from the busses and cars right on Damen.  However, the food is always good and I really like the wooden decor.  Their mocha martinis are also rather tasty.  Don't forget to brush up on your table hockey skills in the back room for a couple quarters!

Food was solid. I am pretty sure my friend said something to the effect of she was eating her french fries like they were running off her plate. They were that good. What killed it for us was the service...  I give 3 stars because of  we were 2 people who clearly weren't ready to order and our waitress come over about every 4 seconds.  I was pretty much mid-tears every time she came over because we were talking about some pretty difficult stuff, but she still kept coming back. Who keeps coming to the table with the crying girl already??! Give us 10 minutes already.  I would go back, the food was good probably in the summer - they have a decent patio

BEST.  FRIES.  EVER.  Even after being employed at this establishment for nearly two years, I still crave the food.  The chili is loaded with goodies, the mini corn dogs are pure bite-sized bits of joy and the pizza is brick-oven style.  Hooray for bar food that doesn't make me feel like I've eaten a bucket of grease!   Aside from the food, the atmosphere is typical tavern, but the "twist" comes from an amusement park theme, stemming from the historical Riverview Amusement Park, which used to be located near Roscoe and Western Avenues.  I love me some Chicago history, and appreciate any business that educates its patrons, but I also think the theme encourages more children than necessary in a bar with a full liquor license and several giant plasma tv sets for sports fans.  If you want to watch a game, this is the place to be, but beware that there may be children listening to you curse and holler obscenities, if you do that sort of thing.   I wish I could say something about the service that won't make me sound biased, but I can't, so here goes nothing:  The employees are all seasoned industry-folk and good people who sometimes might not get to you as quickly as you'd like.

3.5 stars if I could.  We ordered a buncha apps, and mostly they were very good.  The spinach/artichoke dip was a little too thick for my taste, but we ate it anyway.  The mini pretzels were tasty, and the cheese dip was killer.  We'll be back.

Either last summer or the summer before, my wife and I wandered down to Roscoe Village.  It was one of those 'dog days of summer', and the walk from Lincoln Square in the mid day heat gave us a thirst. Enter Riverview Tavern.  Respectable beer list with a couple unique (or at least rare) offerings, a decent pub menu including a couple unique salads, and a friendly attentive staff land this place at a solid 4 stars.

Okay, I flat out loved this place. Sipped on some delicious screwdrivers for only $4.50 each, and let me share an important detail...they were made with Tropicana OJ. I thoroughly appreciate name-brand juice being used in my cocktails.  Friendly bartenders and patrons, including a herd of Santas, Mrs. Clauses and Wise Men who were finishing up a Christmas bar crawl - hilarious! Lots of places to sit, depending on how much you want to socialize. Nice big booths for more privacy, or a seat right at the bar so you can see everyone who comes in.  The best part for me was the music selection...I got to hear Spoon, Wilco, Weezer and the Hold Steady all in the same night! I want to shake hands with whoever was in charge of the music, for they did a fine job. If rocking out air guitar  to "My Name is Jonas" with Santa Claus, while satisfying my daily requirement of Vitamin C isn't the formula for a perfect night, I don't know what is.

We live nearby and go all the time. Good food, good beer menu, good drinks, friendly staff. There's nothing to even think about. For sure, an old standby. We go for lunch or dinner or to go out and drink all night. It works for everything.

This is cute place, and they have a nice beer selection (Shiner!) We had a nice dinner, and my friend and I were in the mood for warm and cozy - we were proud of ourselves for choosing a place we had never been.  Our waitress was great and attentive, as well.  I dig on the Roscoe Village neighborhood, and perhaps I don't hang out there enough! I would definitely go back - the food was really good, and I was pleasantly surprised!

The location of this place can't be beat.  I've never had a bad meal here, just sometimes bad service.  All of the salads are great, love the black bean burger and regular burgers.  Fries=great.  The outdoor seating in the summer makes it even more enjoyable.

I don't know what is about Riverview, but I can't ever get "up" to be there.  I like going there for a few beers and lunch/dinner, but I've never felt the urge to stay past then, or go if food won't be involved. That being said, I do enjoy their menu.  I love the fresh cut fries that come with most sandwiches, and said sandwiches have all been great.  They also have great Pizza's prepared next door at Robey's. Also of note, they do have GREAT sidewalk seating right at the corner of Roscoe and Damen, a prime viewing spot for people watching, getting lost in the distance, and general day-dreaming, potenitally to the chagrin of your dining partner(s).

Not up to my expectations, the burger was alright but not worth the price I paid for it. I had to walk up from the back room to the front bar everytime I wanted another draft. The wait staff was fantastic outside and in the immediate kitchen area. From the outside this looks like a slice of heaven for a kid of my guile, but the aura of the place seems flat.

I wish I was still within walking distance of Riverview.  It's a great place to go and watch the game, or just to have a drink.  I've never made it back to play pool, but the bar is nice, and seating seems to be more than adequate.  Haven't sat outside, but it seems like a perfect place to eat. The food is AWESOME.  Probably some of the best bar food I've had.  The fries are absolutely delicious, and the portions are huge.  It has a good beer selection, and the beers on tap are always fresh.
